text: Went here for lunch with me and a friend. We both walked away with stomach cramps and just a couple of hours later we were both in so much pain and had the worst food poising.Wanted to give this place a try because it looked good on insta. They also charged $24 for an OVERRATED steak salad with soggy lettuce. My friend had ceviche that was sour and barely editable. Would strongly recommend against going to this place.

Such a cute little spot - a little pricey but would definitely recommend sitting at the bar for Happy Hour pricing for a casual yet intimate dinner!The Salsas de Valiente is a good starter - my preference is the salsa verde. The pork belly taco was succulent but on the smaller side. The duck flautitos are small as well and a pass compared to other dishes. The Papas a la Mexicans were a great side to complement the rest of the items, but the churros are a MUST order - some of the best I've ever had.Staff was very friendly and attentive, and they made celebrating my friend's birthday very special. Can't wait to visit again!

The terrible New York combination of mediocre food, tiny portions, terrible service, AND high ish prices. We ordered the guacamole starter ($20) and got  1/2 a cup of fine guacamole and some watery dips. Our cocktails were pretty good but they took over 20 mins. Our food (we all had the fajitas, not exactly hard to make) took over an hour and was so sub par that I didn't finish it. To make up for all of this, the manager sent over another round of drinks and forced tequila shots on us. We quite literally did not want to spend another minute in this restaurant so we barely touched the drinks and left. For the manager: when you have unhappy customers, don't send over MORE free drinks. Just comp the ones we already bought. Not everyone wants to leave their dinner blackout so they forget how bad it was.

Will be back! Ordered the veggie quesadilla and added chicken. Even though we went a bit off-menu, this was our favorite dish! Rivaled by the tuna bites, which I could eat for days... We also had two drinks (mine was a smoky mescal mix take on a mule and his was the El Pino, which had a nice spice to it). The theme is fun - centered around a lottery game that's been played in Mexico since Colonial times. I walked away with a few pretty postcards.
Excellent guac, fish tacos, margaritas, and background dance music. Sat at the bar which had no wait on a Saturday at lunch. Will be back!

Great food amazing service and the drinks we're phenomenal. The bar tender Yuri was great!!! Definitely coming back to this location. Great ambiance. Good spot for lunch with friends, even a date. 5 stars!!
Drinks, Food and Dessert were awesome... music was good and kept us upbeat ! perfect place for a non rowdy but lit Friday night with friends .

Came here thinking it was another place, which turned out to be right around the corner. I had made a reservation through Open Table, and when I was seated by the host, they asked if we wanted to be in the bar for Happy Hour menu or the main dinning area for the full menu. We chose the Happy Hour menu, but then they wouldn't verify my reservation for the points, which was kinda wonky tbh. The Happy Hour was fine prices for the neighborhood. It's an upscale taco place. Definitely splurge on the chips and salsas. The three kinds are truly delicious and they'll bring you more chips at no additional charge, which was a fortunate surprise. I got the pollo taco, which was good, not amazing, but pretty tasty. We also got the duck confit app which was super small for the price, but also tasty, so toss up on value there. It didn't get very busy on a Tuesday night. There are tables in the bar area for Happy Hour along with plenty of bar seating, and a large dining area for the full menu. I would recommend if you are interested in trying many different kinds of tacos that you do the Happy Hour where you pay per single taco and can mix and match, instead of on the full menu where you get two tacos per order and cannot mix and match those two.

This place have very good food. The service however, not good. The music was playing extremely loud. We requested to have the music turned down a bit so we could talk with each other. The water guy ended up spilling the water on my friend across the table from me. He was brand new so that is not a particular negative for me, as I understand learning can be bumpy. I would go again just not in a group.

Restaurant week lunch menu review:We went to la loteria on a weekday to a pretty empty restaurant. So we got to sit at the choicest corner. The space is very cute with motifs and unique decor.The restaurant week menu is quite expansive, unlike other places- so there is a lot to choose from. There were a lot of vegetarian choices as well, as is with all Mexican restaurants.We selected corn on the cob, empanadas and a queso dip as starters. Our mains were chicken & veggie tacos. The food was delicious and so loved the queso dip! The only issue we had was that open table had a $29 menu for lunch which included dessert but the restaurant had $26 menu which did not include dessert. But Our server was so sweet to bring us  a plate of churros on the house! This was an absolute steal at $26 per person!!

Ok, so we came here yesterday for a friend's birthday. It was his 30th. There were 7 of us. The service was beyond outstanding. They let us come in early and decorate a little corner of the place by our table. They brought out our home made cake with candles, and then cut it and served it to us. They were super attentive in terms of refilling drinks, taking orders and bring the food out in a timely manner and I accidentally got a free wine. Didn't mind that at all. ;) [update: apparently they did charge for it, according to my friend. Oh well, still good!]In terms of the food, we started off with the guac and chips, and let me just say the guacamole was P E R F E C T. I'm not of Hispanic or Latin descent, but I am very picky about my guac. It needs to be seasoned to perfection, have right amount of lime, cilantro and onion. The avocado has to be fresh and the right color. This guac was all of that and beyond. I was starving when it arrived but it was just so fresh and yummy, I ate it like a maniac. Almost got full. Almost. If only it were so easy for me to get full. Oh, and it came with three little salsas. One was peanuty, almost Thai flavored. The second (my favorite) was cilantro and much like an Indian chutni. The third was tomatoey salsa. That one was ok. I had my standard Pinot Noir, while everyone else had cocktails and margaritas, so my glass got passed around the table for a "smelling" and everyone agreed it was going to EFF me up. And eff me up it did. Long story short, good wine. And everyone else loved their drinks as well. They have some fun margarita flavors like Hibiscus and Tamarind. Finally, the most important part. Food. The reason we chose this place is because they have so many great vegetarian options, and the birthday boy is vegetarian. I noticed on their menu that they also offer loads of gluten free options for Celiac peeps, which is nice. I had the Steak casadilla, suggested by the lovely waiter. My friends had the shrimp casadilla, the vegetable fajitas, the vegetable casadilla, the creamy rice and chicken and vegetable empanadas. All the food was very, very, good. All three varieties of casadillas were presented differently, which was cute, and there was no confusion as to which was whose. I only have two little comments. One is that the habanero hot sauce I requested was not spicy. At all. My spice tolerance is very high though, so factor that in. The second is that the empanadas are bit overpriced for what they are. I took a bite of each one, and for the price and the small size (pictured), I didn't find them exciting enough. Still, this place earned its 5 stars with excellent food, wine, and unmatched service.

House-made salsa sampler, tangy ceviche, molcajete filled with guacamole, crispy pork belly tacos, creamy street corn... the list goes on. If you aren't sold yet, maybe there is no hope. La Loteria was a splendid experience; from the relaxed ambiance to the intricately crafted food and drinks. This place fills up quickly, but for good reason. I will definitely be making a return visit when I am back in the neighborhood!

There is no way anyone can call this "average Mexican food". Enchiladas with mole topped with grilled salmon; Vegetable Quesadilla with spinach, zucchini, squash blossoms, carrots, peas, beans with a delicate lacing of cheese and complex flavors; De Fideo Tacos filled with bird's nest pasta, avocado, cotija cheese, and whatever else; Tostatidas which are 5 light crispy disks almost like Mexican rice crackers topped with Mexican style chile-rubbed, pan-seared tuna, sesame oil, guacamole, chipotle aioli, mango salsa.Now come on: if that's "average", I want to live in YOUR Mexico. Outstanding service, outstanding food, outstanding dining experience. A bit pricey but can't wait to go back. I'd give it 10 stars if I couldUPDATE: We went back on the first Sunday night they had live music and although the food was just as delicious, the experience was enough to lose your appetite. Unless you know the musicians, DON'T GO. The volume level was that for a concert. The service was horrendously slow - after 75 minutes still no appetizers. Management please decide if you want to be a concert venue or a restaurant because you ruined our dining experience. We will be back ..... but NEVER on a Sunday.

Note: this review is for Restaurant Week Brunch. been here before for regular service and the fish tacos are amazing, service on point, and lovely location.So came here for the restaurant week brunch, and was disappointed to hear the advertised deal was quite as expected (both online and the handed out menus were different than the deal we received). Picked this place for the 1 app + 1 brunch entree + 1 dessert option for $29 but was notified dessert was extra. Now don't get me wrong, I understand things change, but without this deal, I felt like we overpaid for the food we ordered. I mean $60 for a brunch is a bit much, especially with the mediocre French toast and smaller than average chorizo and egg burrito (though the latter was delicious). They were nice in explaining the menu change, but no adjustment to the price means avoid this place for the Restaurant Week Brunch.

Great happy hour with lots of delicious small bites included. One callout- happy hour is in the bar only. It gets crowded and is an overall small space. But, the bar servers are friendly and willing to accommodate you to reach over 5 ppl and get HH priced drinks. Seriously the food was great, down to the chips and salsa. Had an enjoyable time here with girlfriends.
Excellent meal! Loved the speciality non alcoholic drinks! The yucca frites and cheese casserole! Amazing!!
Spaghetti on a taco? EVERYTHING I didn't know I was missing in my life. The Vegetariano tacos were amazing!

Amazing Mexican food in the city. Literally the best fish tacos I have ever had. Drinks are great, bartenders are cool, can't recommend this place enough. They had a great happy hour on weekdays with cheap drinks and appetizers. My wife loves the ceviche, she gets it every time. We both love the sangrias!

My husband and I stopped in last weekend in the evening for some drinks and an appetizer. It was our first time here and I had been wanting to go after seeing the menu online. The place has a nice ambience-- dim lighting, nice decor and good music. I ordered the tamarind margarita to start with and it was pretty good. Our server was great at first but then never really came back to check on us for drink refills or to ask how the appetizer was. We could see our server chatting with the bartender and other employees and using her cellphone. We were able to get the bus boy to come over to the table and asked him if he could get our server so we could order more drinks. After several minutes our server came back. I ordered a michelada and while I'm normally a fan of them, it tasted like the bartender had dumped a whole bottle of Worcestershire sauce into the mug.  We ordered the empanadas and it came with 2 small ones for $19. While the flavor was okay, I can't say I'd ever go back to eat them again. If we ever come back I think we'll sit at the bar top to avoid being ignored by a server and stick to the margaritas.

Unpleasantly surprised. Guacamole is the only thing I'd recommend. Drinks were watered down. I asked for carne asada tacos, instantly waiter said no. I said really you can't ask (I would've paid extra)? "No". They have it in their menu online! So I ordered the fish tacos and they were not good. Steak fajitas - my husbands "go to" and he always eats them all, he left his skillet half full (enough said). Won't go back.

Came here on a Friday night. Sat at the bar. Great food, great service, great drinks. I had a margarita. We shared the home fries and corn and I had the tuna tostadas. The sides were definitely the best part of the meal but overall everything was really good! Chicken tacos with pineapple were also really good! Great gluten free options. I loved the sauces in shot glasses!

6/10 La Loteria has a great location in the West Village. I met a few friends here for a drink and dinner. I ordered fajitas which I found to be pretty average. The portion size was on the smaller side for what you would typically get when ordering fajitas. The staff was pleasant and there were no issues with the service. It was easy to get the attention of bartenders and the wait staff was very friendly.I'd recommend for drinks given its location. I wasn't blown away by the food.

Was very excited to try this spot after visiting Mexico City, but didn't entirely deliver. The food felt more complicated than necessary and somewhat uninspired. Nuts were also prominent in a lot of hidden places on the menu, so folks with allergies be warned.

3.5 - I've been here a handful of times and think it's a very average Mexican spot. I absolutely love their drinks and guac with pork belly but it's definitely pricey. Really nice spot in the summer when you enjoy everything outside.

THEIR FOOD! Okay so I took a mom's day off to wander NYC without my kids. Found this place a few blocks from the place I got tattooed. Best decision ever. I order the prix fixe lunch of the chicken tacos, salad and elotes as the side. I also ordered their classic guacamole and a blackberry margarita. First, the guacamole-amazing. You'll want to lick the stone bowl once you're out of chips. Second, the house salad has all kinds of little treats on top and a sweet yet spicy dressing. Third, the chicken was a crispy chicharrone and had guacamole and a wonderful sauce on top. The tortilla had literally been made to my order. The corn was wonderful. Lastly-the blackberry margaritas was extremely satisfying. The wait staff is friendly and lovely, and for the area the prices were more than fair. Will definitely be back.
I had lunch on my birthday and it really made my day. Delicious food and a nice cute waiter. An excellent Jalapeno margarita to round things off. Ill be back just as soon as I return to NYC

Great Mexican restaurant! Sat outside on the cute patio with my friend this past weekend and we had a great experience. The guacamole is one of my fav! Highly recommend! The margaritas were strong and delish! we also shared the steak fajitas and the cheesy corn. Everything was tasty. Definitley not a cheap meal, but good for a nice dinner!

Cute (but loud) spot with outdoor tables & a bar. My husband and I came for dinner. We got the chips and salsa to start, which was more than enough for two people. I got the skinny marg and he got the regular. We did get a second round but probably would have gotten a third if they came around sooner. For a main, he got the carne asada quesadilla and said it was great. I got the carne asada tacos which were also pretty good. You could choose between getting two or four. Two looked small, but actually following the chips starter was actually plenty for me.

Had a really good happy hour here!We ordered margaritas (mine was the tamarind marg which was on the sweet side, my friend ordered the pinapple/japaleno one - recommend that one as well!).  The guac was delicious here, and I loved the crispy beer battered fish taco I ordered. We also ordered ceviche and salsa for the happy hour and were very full by the end of things.  The portions are decent for everything except the tacos only come one a portion.It's a great place to check albeit maybe a little pricey for what you're paying for - would definitely come back!
Pricy, but have amazing salsas to start! Service can be a bit slow, but I have still come back. I am in love with the salmon tacos

Came here for Happy Hour around 5.30pm. It runs until 7pm at the bar with an extensive food menu. We enjoyed $8 margaritas (a good-size tumbler!) and $7 trio of salsas which were unique (one had peanut flavor!) but almost puréed, rather than the chunky style I realised I prefer. The chips were so-so (bland, not much texture) but a generous portion. My boyfriend ordered a few tacos which were two-bite size ($5-6 each from memory) - the fish was excellent he said while the one with angel hair pasta was 'interesting'. He was underwhelmed by the actual taco, but also, he's been to Mexico. I had some seasonal vegetables ($7) which arrived as a sautéed medley of corn, peppers, mushrooms and greens. It was much tastier than I'd expected, especially when I topped it with some salsa! The interior was really nice too, cool and modern without being sterile. Staff were friendly and attentive too without being overly intrusive. The only thing missing was guacamole... but based on our good but average food experiences, I'd probably check somewhere else out before returning here. But still, it was an enjoyable few hours by the bar!

Four stars completely for the food. have to deduct the star for the ridiculously loud music inside and their insane prices.  $17 for guacamole? Are you kidding me? Mexican food is so damn cheap to make and they are really screwing you at these prices The food was delicious. But Mexican food should never be this much even in Manhattan

Always enjoy their happy hour and friendly bartenders. Good eats and a cute place. Fish tacos and guacamole are my favorites. Been back many times since first review. LastniAwesome guacamole and their 3 sauces. Steak fajitas were perfect. Have also had some excellent brunches here!

We went around 2pm on a Sunday and the place wasn't crowded, with plenty of space indoor and lots of natural light. The staff were very kind and attentive and we got our water and orders in right away. When the food came, I was so impressed with the presentation of the Chilaquiles from the brunch menu, and the taste was definitely beyond my expectations, very well done, just the right amount of cheesiness and spice. The fish tacos were also of generous portion, fish were cooked nicely and not burnt. The two of us found the portion perfect for a late brunch and would definitely come back to try the churros for dessert. Highly recommended!

My husband and I were craving Mexican food and La Loteria did not disappoint. It was a warm night in NY so we were originally going to eat inside but the music was really loud so we opted for a table on the sidewalk which was good. The food was delicious, I would recommend the ceviche and chorizo queso for appetizers and then we really enjoyed the fish tacos and steak fajitas. The drink menu is extensive and we both got jalapeño margaritas which were awesome.

this place was so cute on the inside! i had the chicken tacos. so good! i have no clue how they cook the chicken but it tasted amazing. there was guac, cheese and chicken on my taco. i asked for sour cream on the side and they give u the sauces in a shot glass with a tiny spoon. so cute! i had some chipotle sauce but too spicy for me. i'll just stick to sour cream. need to come back and try more!

Had a great experience at La Loteria last week. We were seated on their cute little patio area and everything we ordered from the guac, ceviche, tacos were really good. Nice bathrooms and decor are a definite plus along with really friendly and laid back service.

Yay for happy hour! My date and I are huge fans of tapas and I'm glad he brought me to this place. The service was great and the food came out quickly. It was relatively quiet when we came, so we had a pretty nice chat over some tapas. Ceviche de Pescado ($7)- 4/5 This ceviche is based on their daily catch of the day. I believe it was sea bass and it was quite tasty. A little sour since it's cured in a green citrus base and has tomatillo, pickled cucumber, avocado, corn tostada, but I enjoyed it with the chips! And the portion was good for 2 people to share. Tostaditas de Atun ($7)- 4/5 This comes with three of these bite sized Mexican style pan-seared tuna with guacamole, mango salsa and flour tostadas. They're really small but delicious and have a great mix of texture (crunchy from the tostadas) and soft and juicy from the other ingredients! I could have easily ate several of these. De Pescado Baja Style ($6)-4/5 Mexican beer-battered catch of the day- the fish was fresh and came out nice and hot. They give you two pieces of fish.I like how they wrapped it so the ingredients don't fall out from one end, like many tacos. This comes with a green sauce as well, which was tasty. It's missing my lemon though.
Great happy hour! Had the de Pescado Baja Style tacos (fish tacos) and they were excellent. Good margaritas, too.

Had brunch here and was pleasantly surprised with the aesthetic of the food and the taste was phenomenal. I ordered steak and eggs and my table got the unlimited mimosas which is only for an hour. I would definitely come here again with 2-3

Came her for dinner on a Friday night.  Overall, just an average Mexican restaurant.  The weather was beautiful so we sat outside which was very nice.  The margaritas were really good. The guac was average at most, I have had a lot better (Barnacho on 49th and 2nd).  For my main meal I got the steak quesadillas.  For a $26 quesadilla I was very unimpressed. That strong, spicy Mexican flavor just wasn't there for me. I have had plenty of better quesadillas in my day. Overall, would I go back to this place, yes, if I was invited to a dinner or something, but there are plenty of other Mexican restaurants in Manhattan.

Ambiance was good, food was great. It's unfortunate that when my party of 13 arrived, there was no place for us to sit. I made the reservation 3 weeks ahead, spoke to the manager a week ahead to confirm, and even discussed timing with him day-of the reservation. Seems like he didn't have the foresight to share the reservation information with his staff, who squeezed us into a tiny bench so that there were two people to one seat. It was a very uncomfortable experience and I don't think any of us wish to return.

Terrible service and expensive. My wife and I went there after lunch time and the hostess informed us that they only had chips, guac and drinks. We were fine with that, so we sat down and waited for someone to take our order. The hostess came back a couple of times and informed the same thing about not serving food, but didn't take an order. We waited for almost 10 minutes on the table and since no one came we moved to the bar area. The $14 guac was average tasting with no salt and the drinks as I mentioned earlier was expensive. The employees are more concerned about hanging out and  chatting. Definitely not worth the visit.

A tad skeptical about this restaurant given the high prices. However, Tuesday afternoon, this was the easiest place to get dinner outside that wasn't too packed. After first getting the menus, took a little while for our order to get taken (still a lot of people considering the nice day outside). Settled on the Salmon Tacos (2 for $15) and a Skinny Margarita ($14). Again, the prices make my wallet hurt, but was hoping for the best. Skinny Margarita comes out first - refreshing with bits of cucumber inside; just not as strong as I'd like. Tacos come out next - two well presented tortillas wrapping a filet of salmon, guac, and several fruit sauces/accompaniments. Gotta hand it to them, the taste is outstanding - wonderful combination of fruity spice on top of the fish. The side of hot sauce provides a great kick and is addicting.Service picked up towards the end and water was refilled periodically. The tacos here are really good, plus the guacamole looks amazing. Happy hour would be the best choice to stop by.

I loved the food here!!! I ordered the scallops and they were perfectly cooked. The scallops had a nice crust and were still succulent and juicy. The accompanying corn cakes(?), salsa, sauces were a perfect addition the the beautiful scallops. Passion fruit habanero mocktail: this was divine!! It was a perfect balance between sweet and spicy. The habanero definitely has a strong kick-I loved it!

Food had good flavor and was large-portioned. However, several things went wrong. The food took an hour to come out, it was cold, and the service was poor. We would have sent the food back to the kitchen to be heated, but our waiter never checked on our food once. We waited so long for the checks that eventually some other waitstaff stepped in to help us. It was also overpriced.

The guac and chips complemented our Brunch mimosas, The Chilaques definitely filled out stomach, the chicken was tender and the dish had great taste! It didn't leave us room for desserts. A good place for Mexican brunch and a good place to hangout!

I had brunch at La Loteria a few weeks ago and the food was amazing! I got the chilaquiles- highly recommend getting this dish! We also got unlimited margaritas however I felt that the drinks were way too sweet and difficult to finish- not worth $25. It's tough to find a boozy brunch place that has high quality food but La Loteria was a really great choice! I would definitely go back again for the food, not the drinks. Most places don't have average food but the drinks are good, La Loteria is the opposite.
Best Mexican I've had in NYC. Fresh ingredients.  Nice people. Wicked margaritas!  Generous happy hour menu. The duck confit flautitas with three sauces was so delicious.  Will happily return.

Nice spot for some fantastic fish tacos. The churros were also really unique, they were filled with something very tasty in them. The fish tacos were very light and crunchy and had a generous potion of fish too. The guacamole with pork belly was really great too, with chicken it was a bit dry. The chicken tacos were pretty dry according to my friend too and the barboca tacos were good but not great. Seating is a bit crammed in here and it can get loud. Decor is nice and the staff is friendly.Margaritas were good too and had a good lunch to them. The combo guacamole salsa thing is not worth it, would just get more guacamole. Coffee here is also very good too!

First Time here. Great service from bartender. Multiple pre Fixe lunch special options for under $20 but I opted for a tequila and two tacos for $10. Food was tasty, atmosphere and music upbeat and i would come back again. These are the barbacoa and pollo tacos. $5 each with lots of meat.
Decent Mexican, but not great. I wouldn't come back here because the food is pretty average. Service is great - very accommodating.Guacamole is great. Chicken Enchiladas are okay-good.

Overview: A Mexican spot that makes you think beyond the typical burrito or taco. Overall a great spot to suggest for brunch or dinner. Dish Ordered: My partner and I used the Restaurant Week 2018 Brunch menu. We ordered unlimited mimosas as well. I ordered Esquites, Huevos Rancheros, and Flan. He ordered an empanada, chorizo burrito, and churros. My food was flavorful and delicious. Probably the best Mexican food I've tasted without feeling heavy or overloaded. My partner commented that this was the best he's tasted in terms of quality.Service: Everyone was extremely attentive. We ordered unlimited mimosas and had our glasses constantly refilled for the next hour. Was neither too pushy nor too distant. Other Observations: The decir was clean and bright while still keeping true to the Mexican roots. Great lighting for taking good photos!

The food was very good and so were the margaritas. I recommend trying margaritas of different flavors, they are very good. I went for restaurant week and loved that they had a lot of vegetarian options; what I didn't love was that the appetizer that I got had the same vegetables as the entree like there are no more vegetables in the world? The other reason why I don't give it five stars is that the service was very good but the waiter seemed to forget about us from time to time. The place is nice and they play good music, I went on a Friday night and it was busy maybe other days of the week the waiter would be more attentive.

Best Mexican restaurant in NYC!  I go to "La Loteria" almost every week.  The food is truly exceptional. Chef Julieta Ballesteros elevates traditional Mexican dishes using French techniques as a way to enhance flavors and aromas.  I like to think of La Loteria as "elevated Mexican". To start you must have the guacamole combo. The delicious guacamole can be topped with different meats such as tuna tartare, pork cracklings or rib eye.  It also comes with a trio of totally unique salsas: Chile de Arbol, tomatillo and, my favorite, spicy peanuts. The margaritas are to die for, especially the tamarind one. Not too sweet and slightly tart. Make sure you ask for the spicy salt on the rim. The duck confit flautas is one of many signature appetizers, they are served with mole sauce, a traditional Mexican spicy chocolate sauce.  If you decide to have tacos La Loteria is famous for its fish tacos made of lightly fried sea bass. It comes with a delicious cole slaw and a cilantro based salsa.  If you are on a diet you can ask them to grill the fish instead. The barbacoa taco made of braised beef cheek is super juicy and literally melts in your mouth. It comes with a smoky salsa. Yum!My absolute favorite entree is the sea scallops. They are always seared to perfection and accompanied with huitlacoche mushrooms (Mexican truffles) and pan de camote (Mexican corn bread).  For desert, well it's a toss up between the churros filled with gooey deliciousness or the silky Mexican flan. Just have both!!!

Came on a Thursday night for NYC Winter restaurant week. Was seated promptly with no reservation (table for 4). The menu consisted of alot of flavors and spices which was eye catching to me. The vibes in the place are very chill and modern. Great music selection that gets you movinnin your seat. The service was quick and efficient, no hassle. Our waiter was very pleasant, offered suggestions on the menu. Overall, great experience and very tasteful food for the cost. We didn't have any drinks, but the Sangria did look very tasteful with the pineapple wedge.They offer a gopd selection of HH based on the menu.

Best Happy hour spot in the WVill!!! Plus everyone who works here are super super nice! The spicy margarita is the best in the city, sangria is sneaky strong (drink with caution) and the fish and chicken tacos are the real deal. Go, enjoy, and don't tell anyone so I can have my regular seat at the bar

Great cocktails and pretty good happy hour food and drink specials! I came here with a group from work and had a good time. While the tequila concoctions are not as unique and interesting as the late Mayahuel, La Loteria has some solid cocktails on the bar menu.

Food is just outstanding, this place is a real treat:- The ribeye is one of the most magnificent dishes I've ever had anywhere. - The scallop and huitlacoche dish was also very good, but somehow Im hoping the huitlacoche flavor could be amped up a bit, it was too subtle, almost lost.  - Short rib taco was perfect. The veg fideo taco, while having nice flavor, I didn't really understand. I guess noodle tacos are a thing somewhere. Carb bomb--perhaps ideal if you are planning to run long distance the next day.- Guac with fried pork belly was very good though pork belly needs to be even crisper--it also loses crisp as it sits in the guac.- Ceviche was quite average--not up to the creative standards of the other dishes.- We didn't order but saw the enchiladas going out and they looked amazing.Great service though room is loud at night and seating is pretty cramped.  Lunch menu has many fewer items than dinner menu though if you ask nicely they may do dinner items for you for lunch.

I finally managed to make it this fine place for lunch. It was a cold day not too long ago (last week), and a short walk from the subway station. I noticed there weren't a lot of people which was great so the noise level was low. The interior is casual, sort of quick in and out type of place.The menu is quite diverse with all the favs from Mexico. I really liked the variety of guac options with a number of meat mixes. From wanting everything on the menu we decided on ceviche, fish tacos, and braised beef tacos. There are two pieces each which was a little concerned about but when they came out they were really large! There's only one way to say this, fantastic! The food has a very clean taste while not taking away from the authentic flavor profiles. The sauces are excellent too. The green one is very much like an Indian chutney! There's also a habanero which was amazing. The ceviche also had a nice citrus flavor which was loved.I will surely return as soon as I can to try the other menu items.
AMAZING Mexican food in the West Village of NYC. The guacamole is absolutely to die for as are the steak fajitas. Small place with a great ambiance. Churros were also amazing!
Food was great!  and Andrew D was a great waiter! Gave great suggestions and very attentive!

When my friend asked me to get together for a taco dinner, I mentioned how I had been curious about the Mexican fare at La Loteria, and we agreed to check it out.  Our experience began with addictive, salty tortilla chips and the Traditional Guacamole, which we both found too watery, due to an over-zealous about of lime juice.  I also ordered the La Rosa cocktail, because what chip-and-dip combo would be complete without a cocktail pairing!  The tart and smoky drink included tequila, mescal, and fresh blueberries.  It was so delicious that I actually wound up indulging in two of them.Then, it came time for our taco extravaganza; since each order came with either 2 or 4 tacos, and we wanted 3 each, we decided to get 3 of the 2 tacos portions and share them.  The De Barbacoa contained tender, but slightly dry, beer-braised beef cheek, though its flavor was enhanced by the addition of caramelized onions and cilantro.  The De Fideo tacos were like nothing I had ever had before.  I knew that fideo was similar to a paella, but using small pieces of pasta in place of rice, however, I had never seen that noodle dish stuffed into a soft taco shell!  The pasta was topped with a tomato-jalapeño cumin paste, avocado, cotija cheese, and a Mexican cream.  Plus, we added sautéed mushrooms and spinach for substance.  Lastly, the De Pescado Baja Style variety included Mexican beer-battered catch of the day, jicama coleslaw, guacamole, and a valentina aioli that added a brightness to the fried fish and caused them to surprisingly be my favorite of the trio.La Loteria definitely satisfied our taco needs, but, just so you set your expectations, it did so at a price more in-line with a high-end Mexican restaurant than a taco joint.
I love La Loteria.  We went last night after seeing a show in Brooklyn.  The late night tacos, guacamole and margaritas were delicious! So good, cool and welcoming.

Amazing!!! I can without a reservation and the hostess was so kind...they were very busy and she miraculously found us a table. Jalapeño pineapple margaritas were to die for, shrimp encheladas were delish and our server, Andres (Andrew) was awesome! Very friendly, attentive and knew the menu so well! Bravo!!

Great spot for a relaxed causal dinner that won't compromise on food quality. I had a mixture of 2 battered fish tacos and 2 pork belly tacos. They were delicious and very filling. Also the music was really good, would be great if they made their playlist available on Amazon Music as I would definitely subscribe and stream. All in all a great venue!

Great Mexican with a modern taste. We stopped in during our walk from lower Manhattan to Penn Station on a random Thursday night. The place had a decent amount of people eating, which gave it a busy vibe, but we were seated promptly inside since the sidewalk seating was open during an unseasonably warm autumn evening.  The hostess originally tried to seat us at a tiny round table for two in the center of the dining room, but we asked to be seated at one of the many rectangular tables along the window, which were more suitable for dinner. This was my only gripe - plenty of empty tables and the hostess kept trying to seat patrons at the least desirable tiny round tables. We ordered our wine from a limited, but quality, wine menu and ordered the traditional guacamole. Very fresh and tasty; the red onion and creamy avocado mixed perfectly with the generous portion of tortilla chips. For our meal, we ordered the most delicious sea-bass tacos, which were beer battered and fried, served in a soft taco shell with savory coke slaw and spicy aioli. Despite being deep fried, they retained a light fresh taste. We also shared a small plate of Tostaditas de Antun, which was chili seasoned seared tuna poké (my description, not theirs) with mango salsa and spicy aoli. Delicious. Everything was seasoned in a balanced way with the fish complimenting the creamy aioli and spices in both dishes. The service was good as well. Our waiter was attentive but left us to enjoy our meal. Cost was what you'd expect for Manhattan - not a bargain but not terrible; it just adds up quickly. We highly recommend this restaurant.

Usually when I visit lower Manhattan I wind up parking in the area around Soho or the Village.  On the way back to my car I needed some dinner so I decided to check out La Loteria.  This restaurant is a really nice space.  It has a nice, clean, modern appearance with white walls, tasteful furniture and some cool prints hanging on the walls.  Off to one side is a small bar area while most of the restaurant is dedicated to regular seating.  During the warmer months there is also outdoor seating.  There is a rest room on the main floor with more downstairs.The staff was very nice and cool with answering questions.  I tried the Guacamole with Chicharrón and that was *fantastic*.  The guac tasted fresh, salty, savory and bright all at the same time.  I had to push it away so I would have room for my other food!  The Ceviche de Pescado was a let down because it was WAY too sour for my tastes.  I understand Ceviche uses citrus but it was SO incredibly sour I couldn't take it.  I wound up not finishing it.  On the other hand, the De Pescado Baja Style was excellent.  The fish was moist and crispy on the outside and the slaw gave it a nice crunch.  The valentina aioli was nice and bright as well!I would definitely go back to La Loteria.  I think the Ceviche style is just not to my liking, but everything else was great!

Was expecting the typical tasty but-not-really-that inspiring mexican food and was actually quite impressed. The chicken enchiladas were really interesting, as were all the small plates we tried -- queso, empanadas, etc. Unique and well worth a try. Only quibble was with the guac, very small portion for the price.

If you are familiar with the area, you might remember Mexicana Mama.  I was so disappointed when it closed as the food was amazing. The food at La Loteria is prepared in a similar style and just as good!  The cocktails are just as delicious!  Staff was attentive and yet laid back.  Really a perfect experience.

Stopped by for lunch with a couple of co-workers. Upon first glance this is upscale Mexican in a trendy, date-worthy place. Music is hipster chill. The design of the place is cool, including a great bathroom on the lower level.Service was okay. He could have filled our waters more considering there was no one else in the place. Food: Had two tacos and a pear margarita cocktail. Drink was way too sweet. Had to add another shot to make it taste like a drink meant for adult tastes. My pork belly taco was small chopped pork pieces highly fried--I was expecting a moist, pork belly experience but it was quite dry like tasteless bacon. I also had the fried fish taco, which was tasty but oily.For two tacos, cocktail and shared guacamole, it came to around $40 including tip.Bottom line: I prefer more down to earth Mexican places that are less hip.

Horrible Customer Service! Came here for my birthday with two co workers. Called the location prior confirming whether their happy hour special were available in their out door seating since my co worker would be bringing her dog along. They stated the specials were available. We arrived 4 pm and no chefs were present. We continued to have a few drinks and patiently waited until 5pm after hearing how amazing their food is. Later we were told by the manager that the information told over the phone was incorrect. We were the ONLY customers present and they didn't even care to accommodate, but instead took advantage that outdoor seating was our only option due to my coworkers dog.  Complete waste of my 2 hours! Def need to learn how to treat their customers or better yet have their workers informed of their policies
Excellent food. But tables are small and the space feels cramped. Shrimp quesadilla was amazing.

I stopped into La Loteria for an early dinner the other night. The daily special was salmon tacos and they were fabulous. They had a nice mix of sweet with this pineapple salsa and spicy with a green sauce on top. They certainly didn't skimp on the meat. They gave a huge piece of salmon on each taco! Very tasty! I also ordered the corn on the cob because the yelp pics look so beautiful. It did look beautiful on plate, but unfortunately ours came out cold. The servers were nice so I'm sure they would have taken it back, but we were in a bit of a rush. We also ordered beans and rice which were both really tasty. The black beans were really light and flavorful and the rice was actually some kind of special rice with cheese and caramelized onions throughout. Overall a very tasty dinner that kept me full for the rest of the evening. Oh, and the music selections they had playing were great! Fun but chill and perfect for an early dinner.
Great tacos that are surprisingly filling! Didn't have a margarita but it looked pretty good. Me gusto La Loteria!

I came to La Loteria during restaurant week with 3 of my friends. We made a reservation in advance. I would recommend doing so, as the restaurant is small. The drinks were great. We ordered off the restaurant week menu and shared our appetizers. We had the ceviche of the day, queso with poblano peppers, corn and mushrooms, and empanadas. We loved all of them. The ceviche was fresh and the all the dishes were so tasteful. For an entree, I ordered the beef short ribs and omg! So delicious and perfectly cooked! My friend ordered vegetarian tacos and she really enjoyed them. For dessert, we ordered the flan and churros. The food was truly excellent. Also, the server was so helpful and he really knew the menu. Although the menu said gluten free for some things, he did let us know that there was a chance of cross contamination. My friend having celiac, was very appreciative that he told us! Otherwise we never would have known and she could have became sick. I loved La Loteria and can't wait to return!

Pros: the happy hour (cheap drinks and tacos), the generous servings of guac, the fish tacosCons: this isn't authentic Mexican. There are a few items that are very good, but if you are looking for real Mexican food, this isn't the place (with that said - i have found very few authentic Mexican spots in Manhattan).

The food was really good but the service could be improved. Two of my friends had to wait a good 25min after everyone else got their food for their food to arrive. The good things was the waitress recognized the bad service and compensated by removing the cost of the late dish from our check. Overall i would recommend the place.
Worked hard to give us a table on a busy Friday night, service was fast, food was good (not fantastic). They have bottomless chips so order a salsa or guac before your meal.
Great food! Awesome portion sizes. The guacamole/salsa combo was very good. We split two orders of the enchiladas amongst 3 people and it was perfect. Or server Augustine was nice!

We ordered the trio of salsas and chips which I thought was delicious. The chips were crispy and the salsas were good. My favorite was the peanut based one. I had the de barbacoa tacos (2) which was lacking the flavor and extra kick I was expecting. I thought it was pretty basic. My friend got the pork belly enchilada and she loved the presentation and the flavors. I tasted the pork belly and thought it was very good. It was moist and juicy.This place is a bit pricy for Mexican food but service was good and I really enjoyed the chips and salsa.I would not return because there are so many other options in NYC. I was in the area and craving Mexican food. I would not travel to come here.

La Loteria is the choicest Mexican restaurant in Greenwich Village.  It has the tastiest food, and a one-hour $25 all you can drink margaritas for Sunday brunch.  The fish tacos and chilaquiles are incredible!  This restaurant has been my friends' and my go-to brunch place for a long while now.

The food is fine, but the service is HORRIBLE. Currently sitting at a table where the empty glasses haven't been taken away since before entrees came out and no offer for additional drinks. The server forgot that we had ordered dessert. When we asked for a special request on the menu, he said no wouldn't even ask the kitchen - and it was a VERY common request. Would not recommend to anyone.
This is not the best Mexican food in town. There are only a few wonderful and delicious dishes. Service not too fast but not slow.

Great ServiceThe service was outstanding, the food was even better. Great ambience as well. I have visited the restaurant twice and every dish and drink, different each time was delicious. The balance of the flavors and the presentation are top notch, particularly for the prices the restaurant has.

I gather from a read off the menu that this place has a food category for west coast Mexican cuisine ... They have beer Pacifico and fried sweet plantain as well as a variety of dishes ... But the menu selection is limited ... Drinks age ok .. I had the Malacha with a side of tequila ... Overall it was average ... Staff is very polite but not too attentive .... Felt like Iceland in the winter (lol)

Came here for brunch on a Sunday. We got there at 11:45am and were the only customers. By the time we left about an hour and a half later it was starting to get busy.  We sat outside, the inside is very cute though. The food was delicious. I ordered the chicken tacos and enjoyed them very much. We both opted to add the bottomless mimosas for $15. The mimosas were a bit heavy on the juice for my liking (I'm more of a champagne with a splash of OJ type) but our waitress was always ready with the refill the minute the glass was getting empty. Next time I may go for the bottomless margaritas or sangria, which are $25.

Came here with my boyfriend a few days ago. The service was great, though they did push for us to order salsa and nachos (we got guac instead). I ordered the sincronizada and my partner ordered tacos de fideo. My meal was very very filling, and my partner enjoyed his, although I thought his tacos were few. The drinks were good, I got a blueberry margarita and bae got a Modelo negra.

The fact that they only have happy hour at the bar and not at the regular tables is dumb. Asked the waiter if I could get happy hour drinks and tacos and said we had to move to the bar. We didn't as it was full, so we paid double the price of happy hour prices (so normal price). Got a passion fruit margarita, barbacoa tacos which I hated. The tacos came out so fast which was questionable. Maybe they were already made/prepared beforehand. Total of $36 including tax and tip. Won't be coming back.

This restaurant is fantastic.  The decor is bright, modern, open.  The service was attentive.  The food was very good. We had salmon tartar, ceviche, and chips with guacamole and three salsas.  All fish was bright, fresh and balanced.  Wine was good.  The guacamole was tasty.  The salsas!  Get those.  Get the combo and try them all.  The salsa verde was pretty typical- but very well done.  Both the peanut and roasted chili salsas were finely processed, almost whipped in texture.  But, oh man, were the flavors on point.  Rich, complex, bright and addictive.  Some of my favorite salsas.
Amazing service, food, and margaritas. Went during the pride festival in NYC and had a blast. Super fun atmosphere!

Amazing guacamole with meat of your choice. Super tasty empanadas. Extremely friendly service, nicest owner and yummy drinks. Highly recommend this place. Dont forget to have their dessert in terra cotta. For brunch, their breakfast burrito is a must.

My friend and I were craving Mexican, so we decided on La Loteria based on the menu and the location. We had a reservation, so we were seated upon arrival. It was a pleasant Friday evening, so we opted to take one of the outdoor tables. For drinks, she had a classic Marg, and I had the La Rana mojito. We decided to do Tacos for dinner. They have a variety of options, and you can ordered two or four of each, so it makes for a good sharing item as well. I had two of the De Pescado Baja Style, while my friend went with De Chiccarron de Peurco. The Pescado was really delicious. The taco size was ample, and the flavors were excellent. It had the perfect amount of crisp and spice. Ambiance is cute. The outdoor space is small, so expect to be back to back with other diners. Indoors has more seating and a bar to the left. It was bustling with people. Service wasn't bad. They didn't really check in on us, and we did not get refills on our waters unless we asked. Otherwise, the food and drinks were prompt.With decent prices and a great menu, I will definitely be back here. This is a great spot if you're looking for fancier Mexican food with a fun, trendy atmosphere.

My bf and I came here for bottomless brunch on a Saturday afternoon and it was not that packed. It is a medium sized restaurant with low noise level, bright atmosphere and outdoor seating. We shared guac and chips, chips were warm and crunchy, the guac was delicious and filled us both up! My bf got the chilaquiles, we both did not like it (maybe it's just not our taste), but the waiter did say that's their most popular brunch dish.  I ordered the Baja style fish tacos and they were AMAZING! I only ate one since I was already so full from the guac & drinks, my bf gladly finished the other 2 and loved it.
This place is awesome  really great food 1hr drink specials It's a win win Plus,great service .
$20.00 all you can drink Bloody Mary's on Sunday for Brunch.  Enough said...(Food is amazing too)

3.5 stars food was well prepared but a couple of small glitches. Hours posted imply you can get food from 4pm and I made a res on OpenTable to do that but I received a call from the establishment saying no food will be available.  So with the choice of going earlier 3pm or later 5pm we opted for 3pm.  It was still brunch time - which we were not really interested in as we had chosen the restaurant based on the dinner menu.  Anyhow, on with the review. Nice decor, outdoor seating is offered.  Started with a margarita, v.basic and didn't seem made to order - not sure if it was part of a bulk made "brunch" batch or if this is the regular margarita. Salsa trio & guac - guac was delicious salsa trio we only liked the green one.  At $19 a little spendy with a small bucket of chips (we asked for more).Chicken & fish tacos - all were delicious and ample portions.  If you can ask for the cilantro sauce that comes with the fish tacos  to go with the chicken tacos it goes really well with them too :)Huevos rancheros were FABULOUS but if you are giving me a side of beans I would prefer to have the option to choose rice with them rather than homefries. I have had huevos rancheros a lot and these were very well prepared.Waiter was fine but was very focused on working it with the table of lovely young lady brunchers next to us.  Not sure if his charm overload worked but it kept our table of teen girls entertained.  Will be back - hopefully for the dinner menu next time!

Came here last night based solely on yelp reviews. It was a Friday night and my friends and I arrived with no reservations. It was 3 of us and we were seated right away. We started with some sangria and chorizo fundido. Both were on point. I especially like the chorizo fundido. Then we ordered our mains. 2 of us got the chorizo tacos and shared a side of rice and beans. The tacos and beans were amazing. The rice I could've done without. Also, the tacos are tiny, but they are extremely filling! My friend got the enchiladas. She said it was really good and she especially liked the potatoes that came on the side. We were too full for dessert, so we passed on that. I would definitely return here :)
Great food and service! Would recommend the guacamole! The crowd here is the reason for the 5 stars though!

This is just mediocre Mexican food. We went for Happy hour/dinner as it was an awkward time where the restaurant was open but the kitchen was closed so had a cocktail and waited till they started serving food. The margaritas were okay for the happy hour price. We had the ceviche which was flavorless and empanadas which had a weird seasoning and were cold inside. My gf had wild Salmon tacos and I had the pork belly tacos which were boring.  Happy hour prices are good, but overall the place is not good enough.

I can't say La Loteria was bad, but I can't say it was great, either.  We were in a hurry because we arrived late, around 7:15 -- just looking for a place to grab something to eat before trying to get to a show uptown.  The staff and the waiter were really respectful of that, considering that there was a large party at a nearby table waiting for service, too.  So they helped us get in and get out pretty quickly.  It was a bit loud as the crowds started to arrive (closer to 7:30 pm).  I'd say the best thing about it was the sangria.  The guacamole and chips were nothing to write home about, nor was the entree I had.  The upshot?  Pass.

May 5th; que es eso que dices?!?! Cinco de Mayo  eyaeyaeya boomchakalaka :) Was in the mood for some guacomole and guacamole I shall receive:)! No coincidence that it's Cinco de Mayo or was it tumtumtum lol.The place was definitely packed. Wasn't sure if I was able to get a table but, I knew I still had a little force in me left from yesterday to especially convince the host to give me a table (Star Wars pun; May 4th) lol.Tonight's menu was dedicated especially for Cinco de Mayo. Got myself the guacamole with fried skirt steak as add on, the fish ceviche, and lastly; there wouldn't be a celebration without a margarita (opt for the tamarin flavor instead of the traditional). Service was absolutely wonderful. Considering how busy they were, I was impress with my server. Didn't get her name but two thumbs up to her. The guacomole was wonderful, the flavor was on point and the skirt steak had a nice crisp on the outside and very tender on the inside. The ceviche, another wonderful dish. Had a great balance of acidity and saltiness.  Lastly the margarita was pretty good. I don't often drink mix drinks, but when I do; I can definitely tell a good drink from a bad one. This one was not just good; it was pretty good. Don't just believe what you're reading, go experience it yourself is my say. Cheers!

My husband and I live nearby, and we've been here a number of times for dinner. We're respectful patrons - we're polite, we order a lot, we tip well. We've brought several of our friends. I tried to go this Thursday on my own for lunch - no activity at the bar, and the dining area was half empty. I walked in and another woman walked into the restaurant right after me. The server, a young woman, saw us come in and asked if we wanted a table for two. I told the server we weren't together, and then the woman behind me walked past me further into the restaurant - I think that woman wanted to see a friend or colleague who worked there. The server tended to that woman - the server tried to make a phone call, presumably to the woman's friend who was working there? - and then a man came out from the kitchen area (another server? the host?) and he began chatting happily with that woman. They began chatting back near the kitchen. Meanwhile...I'm still waiting to be seated. I've come here enough times to know that you don't just plop yourself down just anywhere without any direction. I'm hoping a host or that server will get to me next - instead, the server brushes *right* past me, not saying a word, and starts wiping down tables in the dining area. In the half empty restaurant. She had acknowledged me when I walked in, but was now ignoring me - I've said nothing other than "no, I'm not with that other woman" -- so what do I do now...start waving my hands, begging these people to seat me? I was flabbergasted - I was a server for years, and I would never consider treating anyone that way. I am standing there, awkwardly, still by the door, as some customers finish and leave. The server says goodbye to the customers leaving, but still not a word to me. One customer who was leaving seemed sympathetic - he had been watching and the situation was SO awkward -- I mean, what restaurant openly ignores a customer waiting to be seated? In front of other customers? What restaurant tends to some people walking into a restaurant, but not others?  The customer leaving the restaurant hesitated as he opened the door to leave, perhaps pondering whether he should keep the door open for me because it was obvious I was wondering whether to leave or not. I finally took that as a sign to leave. I thanked the other customer for opening the door for me - I was grateful to get a little kindness from a stranger after that experience.

Amazing fish tacos!!!   The margarita with jalapeño was just the right amount off spicy.   The ceviche unsurpassed.  Even the guacamole and chips were amazing.  The best guacamole ever !  Yummy yummy yummy !  And such friendly staff ! Go there ASAP

Came across this place by accident and was so pleasantly surprised! A friend and I went for brunch, and although it was mid day they were able to seat is immediately (This wouldn't have been the case for a bigger group though - you can make reservations). La Loteria had a great brunch menu, and unlimited mimosas for an hour for $15. The food was all delicious and the guac was fresh. Overall it was a great experience and would love to come back again for a birthday brunch or when the family comes to visit. Good atmosphere for kids too.

The food was very good and our waiter was super sweet. We decided to eat outside because of the nice weather, unfortunately a fly landed in my friends plate. The waiter was so sweet and comped a plate of churros. I would definitely recommend if you are in the area!

Ok bare with me this is my first ever review. (Had to food and service was amazing) But after telling so many of my friends and family about this place i figured i would share it with the rest of the world.  Warm cozy atmosphere and such delicious food! Everything is fresh and flavorful. To put it in a singular word i would have to say this place is "Fantabulous" (ok i made that up.LOL) Best Guac and chips I have ever had a must.  Have gone several times and tried so many dishes and still walk away in awe of the food.From the food to service it is a wonderful experience all around.All orchestrated by Dustin the General Manager.  When you go be sure to order one of there custom Margaritas it would be a crime to leave there without having 1 or 2, or maybe 4 (call an uber if you do) you will not be disappointed.Cant wait to go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Decided to come here with some friends because we know he Chef here is amazing. Chef Julieta Ballesteros has such an artistry when it comes to food.  La Loteria has outside seating available in which we got to enjoy the warm weather. It was perfectly crowded, not too many people swarmig around us. The music was loud enough to create an ambiance. We ordered the queso flameado with mushrooms. BOMB. So cheesy and rich in flavor, in a small skillet. Ofcourse we had to get the guacamole with chicken since one of my friends doesn't eat pork. Also super delish. Our third dish was the ceviche de pescado. Excellent and light,   great for the spring!!  && but obviously margaritas to pair our Mexican dish. The server was really nice and made us feel as if we were his friends. Would definately come back again and try the ribeye chilaquies !! Yummy!  Exquisite job Chef Julieta!

Review is based solely on the margaritas. I really wanted to like this place. Its been on my list to try since it first opened so I decided to hop in one day with a friend to have a drink. The decor and service was great. The bartenders and waiters were very attentive and nice. Very cute place to hang out. The margarita on the other hand was disappointing. It was thick and tasted like they used a mixer. I would not return for drinks but maybe, just maybe I would go back to try some guac (pics on yelp look amazing!).
Small place, reasonable prices with awesome brunch, if you're able to find space (if you don't have reservation)

We were craving Mexican on a Saturday afternoon and happened to walk past his place. Didn't have reservations but were seated immediately. Service was amazing, everyone was super attentive. They have a great brunch drink deal so we went for the $15 bottomless mimosas. They were perfectly made and our glasses were refilled as soon as they were empty, which was nice because you really get your money's worth. Food was great, too. Guac was super fresh and both my friend and I liked our entrees (I got the huevos de benito). Get the churros for dessert!!!
My favorite Mexican restaurant in the city! Great ambience, awesome service, fantastic food. Get the lobster quesadillas! You will not regret it.
I enjoyed the lunches I have had here.  A lot of people consider Mexican food to be more fast food than fine dining, but the chef here is showing that Mexican food can be fine dining too.

Best chilaquiles in the city - so delicious, you can never stop eating them! Great place, amazing food, fantastic service and never a wait! Would highly recommend for all Mexican cravings in NYC!! Brunch unlimited $15 mimosa special!
Really nice atmosphere and staff. Overpriced for small plates. Better to make a reservation before going. Drinks are mixed well but not strong by any means (ask for less ice!)

Nice little Mexican restaurant in the West Village. Although ambiance was great, there appeared to be just one server for the room, so service was slow, and he was quite hectic. The margaritas - esp. the jalepeno one - were awesome! Chips and salsa was great, and the fried fish of the day tacos were very good. Menu was fairly small, so if you are looking for lots of traditional American-Mexican restaurant dishes, you will be a bit disappointed.
Delicious FOOD and service, when for the 1st time on my bday to have brunch with my friend and everything was good

Amazing service-so friendly, attentive. Delicious food--with the exception of my pork tacos that were a little too charred to my liking, came across very bitter/burnt however mango salsa helped and watch out for the Chipotle sauce they serve with the yuca fries delicious but spiccyyyyyyyy lol, overall great restaurant week choice. Margaritas were so tasty and strong, definitely worth revisiting asap!

By far one of NYC's cozy little hidden gems. The place has such a trendy yet cozy vibe, the servers are so knowledgeable and pleasant and the food is to die for. The thought of it seriously makes my mouth drool. It's taste and presentation are top notch.And what can I say about the owner of this great establishment? Super hospitable and friendly yet such a professional. Always makes you feel so welcome and at home yet like a VIP. A true gem of place. A must try if your looking for a cozy nyc experience. See you soon Dustin.

Not as gluten free friendly as their menu makes them seem. The chips are cross contaminated with gluten, so make sure to confirm what you're ordering is gf. I unfortunately didn't know that and got very sick :(

I had an amazing restaurant lunch week special here last week with a couple of friends. For $29 we got a margarita, appetizer, entree, and dessert.  The Yuca fries were excellent as an appetizer. The BBQ Tacos that I ate were delicious. While it only came with two of them, I thought they were stuffed pretty much to the brink.  The flan was a great portion as my dessert and tasty!!The service was sharp and this is now a restaurant I will be returning to, restaurant week or not.

Came here with the bf for dinner during restaurant week and had a great experience. Ambiance: Small restaurant overall and isles near tables were pretty tight but the decor of the restaurant gave it a very chill and comfortable vibe. There were some interesting displays of art on the walls and around the restaurant that had me scratching my head but no big deal. There was also a bar with seats, which had happy hour until 7. I tried a passion fruit margarita which was delicious and definitely had its share of tequila. Food: Let me start with the BEST part of the night. The duck confit flautas were the highlight of the entire meal, and I wish they were made as an entree instead of appetizer. Perfectly crisp, a good portion of duck in each bite, and covered in a sauce that had me scraping the plate. I mean, who doesn't like duck and flautas? So paired together, it as a match made in Duck heaven. Me and the bf both ordered the fish tacos as our entree and while he seemed to enjoy them, I couldn't get through 1 whole taco. The slaw they put on it had a weird taste and the fish itself tasted bland, as if it hadn't been seasoned. Dessert was also meh, but possibly because I'm not a big fan of flan or churros. I would definitely go back to La Loteria simply for the duck flautas and because the server I had was very professional and really made the night a special one. Next time, I may opt to sit at the bar for the delicious happy hour margaritas and my duck. Quack!

To be honest, I swung by here because I needed a quick/local restaurant week lunch after 2 pm, and on review I noticed a free margarita was included :). I am glad that I made an appearance, as this may go down as my favorite recent Mexican meal in the village, and definitely my best restaurant week meal in some time.It wasn't that busy as I strolled in wtih my brother and friend, but I enjoyed the decor which reminded me of Mexico City with all the funky skulls and day of the dead ornaments. The restaurant week menu included a margarita or beer to start (curious what they'd offer if you wanted something non-alcoholic). The margarita was quite good and on the stronger side, but I had nowhere to be afterward. They really did have quite a few choices for restaurant week on the appetizers and main dish. For the appetizer I wnet with the Empanada filled with  Calabaza y Huitlacoche Squash. Inside the fried bread was plenty of chihuahua cheese and bell peppers, this was a great juicy start to the meal! For the entree I got the chicken tacos.  I thoroughly enjoyed the sauces and extras put on them. It was two well sized tacos with guac, cotja cheese, and grilled pineapple. The chipolte aioli added just the right spice to it.Finally, I ended with a very soft baked flan, for once a restaurant week desert was normal size :).The waiter was nice and very patient as one of my friends asked a million questions, and they even made his fish tacos grilled on request.  To me this is what restaurant week is about, finding a spot in your own hood that you may not normally try for whatever reason and have a reason to come back.

Amazing evening at La Lotería! Incredible ambiance, delightful drinks and the professionalism of the staff made our experience worthwhile. We look forward to returning soon. Thank you Santiago for all your suggestions! We found a new favorite spot !

This is an amazing Happy hour from 4 to 7pm.  The margaritas and sangria were both flavorful and strong. The food was delicious and affordable.  We enjoyed all of the tacos including the pork belly, chicken, and the best of all fish! The sauce was to die for! The service was superb!!! Atmosphere was romantic (low lights)...nice spacing between the tables.  Rafael was the highlight of the night. He made sure we were satisfied. His service shows a personal investment in the restaurant!!!!!

A friend and I came here for apps and margs. Adorable decor and personable service. The chips and guac were really delicious, as was the margarita I ordered. My only complaint is that the prices are a little high. Otherwise, it was a great experience!

Came here after getting a recommendation from a friend - had good reviews, and I'm a sucker for reviews, so decided to give it a shot. My dad was visiting so wanted to take him somewhere a bit different than our usual go-to Italian meal. Arriving at 5:30 on a Sunday evening, we were the only ones for quite a while - so needless to say, the service was great.The food, on the other hand, wasn't my favorite. The menu was a bit different than your typical mexican restaurant, which was fine by us. We started with the Guacamole Combo, which was guac and a trio of salsas. The guac was decent, but the salsas all had a similar taste, and seemed to be cream-based. I tend to like my salsa more fresh and tomato-y. The peanut one was interesting, but didn't feel like I could have (nor did I want) more than a few bites of each - too rich. We then shared a bunch of items from the menu: The Wheatberry & Veggie Salad (not enough veggies in my opinion, but flavorful, although had a creamy dressing), the Vegetariano Taco and sides of the Refried Black Beans & Rice with Fideos. Maybe we didn't order right, but all of the food just seemed too rich to me. I felt like they all had some sort of creamy base or similar mystery ingredient. After the salsas, I needed something on the lighter side. I told my dad my favorite part of the meal was the tasty soft corn taco shell!I understand I was at a mexican restaurant, which typically isn't a "lighter" cuisine, but mexican food is one of my favorites, and unfortunately La Loteria just didn't sit right with me.

Excellent restaurant! One of my favorite in NYC. In a nice location on 7th. Though small, it has alot of charm. It is super modern and decorated appropriately with contemporary Latin pieces. The bar area is great and the bartender is great. Food is delicious. The guac and chips were an excellent appetizer, and the spicy vegetarian tacos were also great. The tres leches dessert capped it off! Waiters/waitresses were very friendly and attentive!
Food and service were excellent! Our waiter suggested we try some appetizers as they were and I'm glad i did! The jalapeño margarita was phenomenal! Looking forward to eating here again!

Good but not outstanding, a strange one-hour "all you can drink" brunch for $25, which seems very steep unless you're chugging pitchers of margaritas on your way to oblivion.  Totally acceptable but with more options than ever on the mexican food side of things, not a place I would go out of my way to eat at (nor would I eschew if someone really wanted to go).

Came here after work for dinner and margaritas with a friend - quick review: amazing food, little expensive, small plates really mean small plates.The ambiance is warm, inviting; the metal chairs are a lot more comfortable than they look.  We were very cozy.  I ordered the Flautitas, which were under the "small plate" menu, and it was 2 amazing flautitas cut in half.  They were spectacular.  I wish there was another one (or two).  We both were still hungry after our entree, so we ordered the guacamole with chicken - now THAT was quite a portion, couldn't eat it all.  We were both very happy with the choice; I would definitely recommend it.

Alllll the stars for this place! New favorite Mexican spot in New York. Best hospitality, incredible food, and legit margaritas (no triple sec!!! Score) had steak tacos, guac, queso and churros. All super fresh and amazing

This place is awesome. From Dustin, the amazing host, to Santiago, the coolest bartender who pours the tequila heavy, to the food which was just incredible, la loteria delivers. My new favorite place in the neighborhood. I'd give 6 stars if I could

Made a reservation for my husband's birthday for 8 people. Once everyone got to the restaurant, we were all promptly seated. We started with passionfruit Mojitos and varying flavors of margaritas. The drinks were all pretty good... Although some of them didn't come out on time. Which leads me to my next point: the service was pretty terrible. It took my husband exactly 1 hour to receive his drink--and when we brought it up to the waiter he didn't really seem phased. We ordered guacamole for the table and a trio of salsa with chips... They were all very tasty-highly recommend them. As far as the entrées, I ordered the shrimp quesadilla which was good but not the most amazing thing I've ever had and some of my fellow diners ordered fish tacos and chicken enchiladas. The fish tacos was alright but not vey flavorful--the sauce made it better. Overall, it's Mexican food... It's kind of hard to screw up. If you're in the area definitely check this place out. Not sure if the service was bad because it was a party of 6 or more and the tip was secured at 20% or because it was a little later in the evening and they were eager to get us out.

La Lotteria is an absolute treasure. The food is as authentic as could be- delivering on flavor and uniqueness. The fish tacos are my favorite, but any of the items (including the duck confit taquitos) are executed perfectly. The service is incredibly attentive and personable as well. Although it's a bit on the pricier side, this place is an absolute can't miss.

Cute, modern, little restaurant that serves beautifully presented Mexican inspired dishes. It was the perfect spot for a girls night out. It's a small place and only good for a large group if you call for reservations first. Service was great and attentive.  I enjoyed everything we ordered, flavors were great. Guacamole was creamier than most guacamoles I've had but was really good. I highly recommend the enchiladas and churros for dessert.

I came here for a nice dinner with my boyfriend on a Wednesday night, and it was quite busy even on a weekday! The ambiance of the restaurant is warm, quaint, and a mix of traditional and chic decorations (I personally loved the cute skeletons hanging on the shelf dividing the bar area from the dining area). The servers are very kind and very attentive (we were asked how we were doing 3 times,  and our water cups got refilled without us asking!) What we got:- Traditional guacamole - served in a stone bowl, and the chips were warmed too which was a nice touch - Quesos flameados de chorizo - really fun dish because you build the little wrap yourself! - Crackling pork belly tacos - a little dry with the meat but great flavoring, and meat was given in large quantities.- Scallops with huitlacoche negro - fantastic scallops with unique sides! Food wise, everything was great! I am a huge avocado fan, and I personally was slightly disappointed by the guacamole. While all the other dishes has their own unique surprises, the guacamole was pretty standard to me. I'd definitely recommend this place to any couple wanting a cute and nice evening without spending too too much on good food & good ambiance!

Kinda unimpressed..We made a reservation for 6 people and were sat at a table that was set to fit 4 and weren't able to move to a bigger table or add on a chair. Not a great start, but it's hard to be mad when you're surrounded by good friends.The next bummer was that our waitress never checked on us once we got the food.  After waiting for a while we had to ask a busser to take our check because our waitress was MIA. Now to the good:The food was great, portions were decent sized, and the décor was really cute. It seems like it would be a good date spot, but I highly discourage bringing a group of more than 4 people here.

I like this place for brunch! Its an hour for unlimited drinks and I took my boyfriend here for some boozy good. The margaritas were pretty good and the bartended this part Friday was on spot with the service! Between the chicken tacos and De Cantina Tacos, the chicken tacos tasted better. The nachos and guac definitely tastes good as an appetizer to start the day off well.
Not sure why this pace isn't busier??? Great take on modern Mexican. The dishes had me thinking. I like a good food challenge.
I have been here twice and I have to say it is a great place. Friendly staff, great pizza (ok even for NY) and Italian dishes are great.
Great food. Great service.Went for prefix lunch menu. Had delicious tacos, street corn and tres leches.

First off I love how cute this place is, with its metal chairs, printed tile flooring and dim lighting ! 5 of us had dinner here. They are a tiny place, so 5 people would mean joining a few tables together which we didn't mind.We started off with the Guacamole and salsa trio ! It's a must have at this place. The Guac is absolutely delicious but it's the salsa trio that blew my mind. They had a peanut variety which was my favorite. They have a super spicy one and a green one which were all flavorful and tasted like nothing I have had before.  We also had  the ceviche and veggie empanadas, which were both fantastic. The tacos at this place are where it's yet ! We didn't have a taco we didn't like. They serve their tacos in 2s and 4s. We tried the Baja fish, pork and veggie tacos. All the tacos were FANTASTIC ! I cannot remember the last time I had such tasty veggie tacos. We also tried the veggie enchiladas ! They were good too. We had a couple of sides as well, corn on the cob and the Mexican fries. The Mexican fries are so different from regular fries, doused in some kinda amazing sauce and they look like stubbier versions of the potato finger. You have got to try it. For dessert we had the churros and a sponge cake soaked in some delicious condensed milk kinda liquid, I forget the name.  The sponge cake was my fav dessert of the night. They served it with pecans and strawberries and it was the bomb. We had dinner here on a Sunday so we didn't have any drinks, it had been a rough weekend The service was really attentive and friendly. This is a solid Mexican place. Loved it.
