Love this place! Drinks and food are amazing! The corn and fish tacos are a must have- as well as the passion fruit margarita!

My boyfriend and I decided to give this place a try last weekend. Perhaps it's because I'm not super familiar with the West Village but it was pretty tricky to find and was not located on 7th Ave where it appeared on google maps. Anyway, after the directional debacle we finally made it there, and I was impressed instantly with the ambiance. It was a warm day, and all the large windows in the front where open letting in a lovely breeze and showcasing the warm, dimly lit romantic inside of the restaurant. We decided to sit inside, but the outdoor seating was ample and looked great as well. We started with cocktails, the Hibiscus Margarita for me and the El Catrin ( Maker, ginger, agave and lemon) for him. His cocktail was pretty average and mine was too tart, not sweet at all. I mentioned this to the waiter, who happily added more agave, and it was awesome on return!  We had the guacamole for an appetizer, which was good and a very ample portion ( little guac appetizer portions are a pet peeve!). We weren't super hungry to we shared the shrimp tacos ( sans bacon for him) and also shared the sauteed scallops. We wanted to try the lobster ceviche, but sadly they were out. We added a side of plantain that came with a very unique dipping cream. Everything was awesome! We ordered the smaller size for the tacos and the scallops, so we didn't leave super stuffed, but it was just enough. For hungrier parties I'd suggest ordering the larger sizes. We didn't opt for dessert, but the menu looked awesome, so I'd love to try it next time. All in all a solid spot, with great service and a lovely ambiance. I shall return!

Really cute place! It looks like it is relatively new. Loved the outdoor seating area (that is where we sat). Came here for a bottomless brunch with another couple. $25 bottomless margaritas for an hour (with entree) or $20-25 (with entree) for bloody mary's = a great Sunday afternoon.. not to mention that the drinks were delicious.Everything was delicious actually.. We had the guac and salsas combo as a starter and everyone really enjoyed it. Followed by fish tacos - they added an extra taco for us without an extra charge (SO AWESOME - tacos comes in 3s and there were 4 of us). Our waited was absolutely amazing. He was very attentive, sweet and funny. He gave delicious suggestions and helped us make all the right choices to enjoy our meal. I had the eggs benedict which were cooked to perfection. Although next time I come I think i really want to try the french toast (I am still thinking about how delicious it sounded). Also, when you check in on SWARM you get a FREE order of churros with some yummy dipping sauces. SCORE!!! We left very full, tipsy and happy. Will definitely be coming back here.

Food was good, where's the tequila as all we saw on the back bar was wine. We had guacamole and a punch of appetizer empanadas de flor de calabaza was the only thing not to my liking.... Soggy despite the filling being tasteful. Ordered a specialty drink of mine more expensive than the competition.

Excellent Food and drinks! I would've given this place five stars had it not been for the neglect in the wait staff. Our server, as nice as he was, was neglectful. In the time that we waited, we could've ordered two more drinks and dessert. Instead, my man friend and I decided to skip it and head to the San Gennaro festival.
Delicious food along with an extremely courteous staff made for an enjoyable evening.  Excellent tacos. They even have happy hour on the weekends! Definitely stop by.

This restaurant is exceptional. The atmosphere is great and the service is fantastic. The food is even better. We had the chips and salsa with 3 different sauces and they were great. The chicken enchiladas were outstanding and had different flavors going on. We ended with the churros which were also outstanding.  Would highly recommend and will be back.

Wrapping up my meal now. I rarely review anything. The food was excellent. $16 for the BEST house salad I've ever had, steak tacos and black beans. Everything was excellent. I wish I wasn't low carbing so I could HOUSE the corn tortillas. I was embarrassed trying to get the last tiny corn kernel from the salad. . Small. Cozy. Really great looking spot too.

This place is just straight up not good. Correction, the food is not good. The service and space are fine. Worst ceviche I've ever had, extremely fishy, and the salads are small and laced with mayo. The margaritas may as well have a Jose Cuevo mix label on them because upon first sip, it's instantly obvious that's what they're made from. There are so many better Mexican spots in NYC to have to ever come back here.

Cute spot and decent Mexican food (coming from a former Texan and Californian). We arrived around 6:30 PM and discovered that there is a happy hour menu, which offers a great selection of small plates so you can try a variety of things. I had the De Fideo vegetariano tacos and plantano machos, and my friend had the De Pescado tacos and squash blossom empanada. Lots of attention to the food execution and presentation, and everything tastes as pretty as it looks. We opted for the flavored margaritas, which aren't really at a happy hour price, but they are good. Our server was attentive and friendly.

The guacamole was just like good table side guac, though not made table side. The food was pretty tasty. Easy to get a table. But the service was a little slow...it took a long time to get the main dishes after the guac.

Brunch ends at 3:45, not 4. If you get there at 3:48 they won't let you have the brunch special. Even if the place is pretty much empty, and you are 1 of 3 tables- it's still apparently too much for them. Food is fine, except for the salsa trio which has a hint of vomit flavor. Go somewhere else.
Awesome. Possibly the best Mexican we have been to in the city. We had various appetizers and mains and drinks and desserts and all were absolutely great. We will be back!
Really unique take on Mexican! The guac is delicate and to die for. Highly recommend the Tacos Pescado. Great for brunch!

This place is fantastic! I stumbled across the location on my last night in New York and I'm so glad I did. From the Chicken Enchiladas to the ceviche and watermelon caipirinha, I was so pleased. The waitstaff was extremely attentive and friendly, Aaron the bartender was very kind and  helpful and gave me directions just where I needed to go. I'd recommend the spot to anyone :)

Food was very good, for sure would go again if in the area, I had the Guacamole, the simple one as they had choices with addition of different meat which I had never seen before, maybe good but I like the traditional one, also loved the Fish Tacos and also liked the Spicy Margarita
Great experience here.  Tacos were great and the churros were also really nice.  Sat at the bar and the bartender was very friendly.  Would give food 4 stars and the service 5 stars.

I had made a reservation for a birthday party of 8 people to sit outside during happy hour for he dinner and drink special. Upon arrival I was informed by the manager that I should have specified it was a happy hour reservation because they do not offer the special outside. Nowhere is this information written online. Only on a chalk sign at the bar. The manager told us that he could not make an exception and that luckily this city has millions of people. Kind helpful staff apart from the manager who made us feel unwelcome. Drinks were A-ok.
Was not impressed at all.  They didn't have hot sauce.  Nothing spicy that was saucy.   Food mediocre and drinks bland. Surprised to see he 4 stars.

one word: obsessed. I've been on a serious search for a solid Mexican place with outdoor seating and a mean margarita in the village. Look no further. This has become our new go to spot for dinner and margs before a night out. Recommend: passion fruit marg, guac with pork belly, fish tacos, rice and beans, sweet plantainsIf you thought this place couldn't get any better, it also takes reservations and is located steps from big gay ice cream. You're welcome.

Really good spot in the West Village. Came here to celebrate a birthday and they did not dissappoint. Had the guacamole with crispy rib eye and honestly I could've only had that and left REALLY happy. Ordered several other small dishes to share (empanadas, fish tacos, flautitas, yuca fries) and everything was really good (probably too much for two people). They were also great enough to remember that it was a birthday we were celebrating and brought out some delicious Churros with chocolate and Caramel dipping sauces out with a candle. Overall great meal and experience and look forward to coming back.

Happy hour bait & switch. We checked out the happy hour menu on their site and lots of great prices but once you're seated & ordering the prices change: guacamole isn't $5 but $14!!! and margaritas are $7 not $6. we pointed out the discrepancy but they didn't care at all.  this place could be decent if they weren't so deceitful. too many nearby mexican places with good happy hours to endure getting scr*wed here.

I have only one tiny complaint with this place, but otherwise the food is spectacular.  My wife and I started with the queso fundito and the guacamole.  The fundito (finally) was a hit.  If you have seen some of my recent reviews, I'm almost always disappointed by this dish elsewhere and this place does it right; a true litmus test of their Mexican authenticity.  However, the guacamole was a disappointment.  It was served in a traditional mortar/pestal style bowel, but was obviously whipped up in the kitchen.  It wasn't that bad, but seemed overly processed and lacked seasoning; surprising, considering the rest of the food was stunning.  My wife had the seafood quesadilla which she loved.  I went with the enchiladas which I elected to be topped by pork belly.  Yeah...  This was pretty the best Mexican entree I've ever eaten.  I don't order pork belly a lot, and I'm not an expert on enchiladas, however; whatever combination of tortillas, cheese, sauce, and meat la loteria served up on this night, it worked.  Too bad the guacamole was a bummer, otherwise this would have been 5 stars.

I don't really get this place.  It seems like it has all the right qualities, it's attractive, interesting drinks on the menu, good quality food.  Ultimately I think it's that the menu arrangement just doesn't make sense.  I always feel like I got too little food or too much, and I often feel like I paid too much for it.  I feel like the main dishes and sides just aren't set up in the right combinations and proportions.If you just want a bar with snacks, it's great.  Good service, nice place to sit.  If you want food, I'm not sure it's the best option in the area.

Awesome Awesome Spot in the west village. Great drinks, great atmosphere, and phenomenal food. Guac - on point (add meat to it), we literally licked the bowl Queso - cheesy goodness! Do it!Tuna Tar Tar - Some of the best I've hadCeviche - PerfectionDuck Flautas - The best

First time here but definitely not the last. We got to sit outside on a beautiful day, because of the location it's easy to pass time if people watching is your sport.  We started by getting a pitcher of margaritas, which were perfect. The food was amazing as well, we got a lot of food and shared everything.  My favorites were the corn (we couldn't get enough), the pork belly tacos and the shrimp tacos. It's nicely decorated and the environment inside and outside is very laid back and lively. They had the music just loud enough where you can hear the music AND your table. Although they were packed every one, host and servers were incredibly pleasant and attentive. We will be coming back soon

Overpriced. Slow service. Long wait for food Terrible creamy guacamole. Burnt pork belly tacos. Gross tortillas. Weird pasta in the tacos. Nasty margarita pulp. Inexplicably hot outdoor seating. Such a disappointment!

This place has one of the best drinks around, when it comes down to Mexican flare.  Their flavored margaritas are delicious, especially the passion fruit and berry which are my favorites. Also enjoyed the three homemade sauces that go along with the tortilla chips, yet the guac falls short as it's packed with flavor but the portion is kind of on the skimpy side.  The jalapeno corn muffin was also delicious, served with a side of queso fresco...yummy!  We were happy to have arrived during happy hour as everything was $5, except for the flavored margaritas which are a dollar more.Overall space is nice, clean yet a bit small but we were fortunate to have gone on an off peak day and were able to take advantage of the seating area available for happy hour deals.The wait staff and bartender were very attentive which is a big plus for me.
Big fan of this place. The outdoor seating option is clutch. My recommendation would be the red sangria and steak tacos. Understatement to say the tacos are top notch!

I came here last week to meet up with some friends for happy hour and to usher in summer and what a fantastic place to drink and eat and not too hard on the piggy bank!I walked in around 6:30pm and the place wasn't completely packed, which was such a nice surprise given that they have great happy hour deals here. Shhh, I didn't tell you about this place. They even have a happy hour menu with quality options and for a bargain!My friends already were seated and I joined them easily at a high 4-top table next to the bar. I ordered a margarita ($6), which was refreshing and well made. Throughout the night, I had two more to help cool me off from the warm weather (finally!) and to wash down the yummy snacks we ordered. Guacamole is excellent here ($5) but the portion was a bit small, so we ordered two servings. It comes with plenty of tortilla chips, which was way more than necessary for the amount of guac we ordered. We also ordered the tostaditos de atun, ceviche de pescado and a side of yuca fries (all $5 each). Tostaditos were tasty especially the atun and loved the accompanying chipotle aioli. I would pass on the ceviche as it didn't taste that fresh to me and it was quite hot the day we came here. So just be cognizant of ceviche on warm summer days. And you can't mess up yuca fries ever and the habanero aioli gave everything a nice kick! My friends also ordered some fish tacos ($5 each) and they both loved it. Excellent place to meet up with friends and get here before 7pm to order up some good food and drinks. Your tummy and wallet will thank you later!

I was at a bachelorette party in NYC in March 2016, and we were wandering around trying to find a brunch place without a long wait on a Saturday (since none of the ones we had looked at accepted reservations for brunch). Fortuitously we found La Loteria! It has a great ambiance, and the food was so good! We got the unlimited mimosas (definitely worth it). Also the waitstaff was amazing! They found out it was a bachelorette party, so they gave us churros on the house too (which were sooooooo good)! I would definitely go back for brunch.

The food is great, the service is great. It's a little pricey and the ambiance isn't my favorite. The decor itself is nice, but it's small without feeling cozy. It gets really loud easily and it's hard to feel settled in there. But like I said, everything we ate was incredible -- SERIOUSLY incredible.

I have been to La Loteria on two occasions- once for happy hour, once for dinner. I have to say, I do like the happy hour. The margaritas are delicious and this place is definitely worth stopping in for a drink if you're in the neighborhood. ($6 margs at happy hour). With that said, there were some misses on the food for me. The guacamole is far too creamy/whipped- it was mixed to death to be frank. Keep chunks of avocado in your guac!! I got the fish tacos as my entree. They were good- not great. An authentic tortilla would be nice rather than that generic store brought tortilla you can buy in your local grocery store. My boyfriend got the chicken enchiladas and thought it was a little odd that the chicken was not inside the enchilada-- there were just tiny strips on top. We got an order of the plantains on the side. I thought they were extremely tasty, however there is no need for powdered sugar on top- they are sweet as is. Our waiter was extremely nice, approachable, etc. The service was just way. too. fast. We were barely half way through our guacamole and salsa when our entrees were served-- and I was half way done with my one drink I ordered by the time we finished eating. People eat out to enjoy/relax -and the pace of a meal is an extremely important aspect. Overall, I may stop in for a margarita if I'm in the area, but not so sure I would go for a full meal again.

Extremely overpriced (lunch approx $28) and the portions are really small. Food quality is good, but definitely not worth the price.  Temperate is not controlled, was very cold inside. Staff is snobbish, probably because the restaurant is in west village?  Staff wouldn't care for you if you are a party of 2 or 3, you need to be in a big group of 6 or more for them to get your attention as you would then spend more money.  There are definitely much better places in the city, save yourself the time, money and the frustration.  Definitely won't return and wouldn't recommend.
Great food and drinks! Also great customer service! Thank you to Jonathan at the bar for laughing at all our silly jokes!

Classy, boozy, upscale Mexican food at polite prices. Been half a dozen times for brunches, dinners, and happy hours, and will certainly be back again. For brunch, the chilaquiles are unbeatable (5+ stars), followed by the huevos de Benito (Mexican eggs benedict). $15 unlimited mimosas for an hour is a bargain - the waiters keep a close eye on drink levels and won't let you go thirsty. The happy hour (at the bar only) includes discounted margs and apps, and is great if you live in the area - but the word is starting to get around and it can get crowded if you show up toward the end (7pm?).For dinner, the quesos flameados are a great way to start (if a bit heavy - 4 stars), and the tacos are delicious and shareable (chicarrones 5 stars, Baja fish 5 stars, ribeye 4 stars). The yuca frita (4 stars) is tasty if you need something on the side. Overall the service is timely and professional (4 stars) and the atmosphere is vibrant and tastefully modern (5 stars).
Sister convinced me to try this place. Don't blame her for loving it!  Best chilaquiles I've ever eaten.

Their fish tacos are amazing! Super tasty and super fresh with a slaw and guac in a fresh soft tortilla. The only thing I would change is add more mayo or crema (because I love them both) but to be honest, they don't need it. Also had their guac appetizer which was more than enough for 2 people. The only downside to that was they can't take the cilantro out. Their wine and beer list were ok but their cocktails look amazing. Was in a rush so didn't order cocktails but their happy hour menu is amazing and so are their weekly specials. Went on taco Tuesday where tacos are $5. Totally worth it.

I've only been for happy hour, but judging from the $5 margaritas and $5 menu my best friend and I had, we left feeling full and happy. It's easy to get sub-par margarita's and I am picky with them because I make a pretty good one myself, but they were strong and tasty! We had an array of food and the tacos were awesome. We had one of each! The chicharon was my fave! The esquites, spanish corn, was really good! Gonna have to try out the Guac on the next go around!

First time at La Loteria after reading the wonderful Yelp reviews. Please, please, PLEASE try those Baja fish tacos. A friend and I split the 5 delicious battered fish tacos as an entree & they were huge ! Paired it with La Dama (agave nectar, lime juice, blackberries & mezcal), a very balanced drink. Overall, very amazing place... I'll definitely be back !

Hubs and I ducked in here for a late dinner. Both of us having grown up in Houston, if there's one thing we know well it's Mexican food; and hubs can never get enough of it. Mexican food should never ever be pretentious; it's a humble food prepared with love, and simple ingredients. A Taqueria should be the least pretentious of Mexican eateries. The closer to the border you get, the more divey they get. Jokingly, the quality of a Taqueria can be judged by its colorful vinyl chairs, jukebox blasting festive norteño mariachi, your inability to communicate with your waitress due to a language barrier, and menu selections made by their picture. Chips & Salsa are ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS bottomless and complimentary. I can tell you having grown up in a state that was once part of Mexico that not being greeted by a bottomless bowl of chips and salsa is unheard of and may be taken as sheer heresy. We ordered drinks. Hubs a sangria, and I a beer. I popped for a Negra Modelo, a well known favorite to Mexicans, and a decent beer. We ordered the guacamole as an appetizer. The guac was spot on, a massive portion but the $14 charge isn't even in the realm of reasonable, its borders on extortion. The profit markup on a $14 order of guacamole is insane! Hubs ordered chicken tacos of some sort, and I the barbacoa. Barbacoa... Another beloved delicacy enjoyed in my home state usually on weekends. Most New Yorkers wouldn't touch the stuff if they knew what traditional barbacoa was made of, or the manner in which it is prepared; but the ensuing result is typically ethereal. Barbacoa is usually served unassuming on a warm corn tortilla with little more than a few diced onion, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime... Perhaps a bowl of menudo too if you've got a hangover to cure. This barbacoa tasted like nothing more than pot roast. A real disappointment. When I was handed the bill, I nearly had a stroke. I can honestly say this was a life's-first for me. Never in my life have I ever had to fork over $50 for four tacos, an order of guacamole, and two drinks. No self respecting Mexican would ever pay anywhere near that. I can assure you as I am standing here that I could easily get that same amount of food from a taco truck for less than $10 and of much better quality. This was a lesson learned in two ways: If I want good Mexican food now that I live in NYC, it's going to have to come from my own kitchen, and secondly I got ripped off big time.

We stumbled across La Loteria during a recent trip to NYC, and we had a fantastic dining experience. We started with delicious margaritas at the bar and then made our way to our table. While ordering a very nice woman stopped by to give us some recommendations. It turned out to be the executive chef Julieta Ballesteros. She could not have been more lovely and genuine, and  made great suggestions.  We particularly loved the guacamole/salsa starter and the tuna appetizer is to die for! We also really liked the lamb special. The restaurant is a bit loud like many hopping SOHO places, but we loved that it was such a friendly  and non-pretentious atmosphere, with great food and drinks and reasonably priced.

When i got here it didn't look like a regular mexican restaurant, because always are more colorful, but this one was different, but good! The food was delicious, i had chilaquiles for brunch and that was very tasty and the perfect touch of spicy that everybody can enjoy without have gallons of water, our waiter Santiago was very helpful and friendly that made our brunch even better. Thank you so much, we will be back soon to try the dinner next time.

The food is great, micheladas are perfectly spicy and refreshing. Guac app is good size, fish tacos are delish. The entrees took a loooooong time to come out BUT the guy comped the 4 of us margaritas for the wait. All around solid experience!

I stumbled upon this place as part of search for locales near West fourth. I was surprised to see an upscale Mexican restaurant a block down from the popular Caliente Cab. That being said...Loteria has a following and if you're going on a Friday or Saturday night.... Make a reservation. The decor hints at Mexican culture rather than immerse you in it. It's ambience is more hipster modern than ethnic. (Still a pretty place though) It is VERY small so be mindful if travelling in large groups and the space can get loud... The more crowded it gets.The food was wonderful. Beautifully presented and portioned well. The mole sauce made here is key. I had the enchiladas with skirt steak and I was very satisfied. Steak was cooked perfectly and the dish was very well flavored. Their signature cocktails are great. Be sure to try one ( or two). Service was friendly and ticket times were reasonable. Loteria is a little pricey if you're looking for a laid back food experience. But if you're in the market for a fresh spin on great Mexican food... Bring a bestie or two for a gourmet enchilada and enjoy!

Not sure how this place has such a high rating. The food is mediocre and way overpriced. In fact I wouldn't even go back for this food at any price. What we got:A lot of different margaritas. these were fine. decently strong. but nothing much better than you'd get anywhere else. the fruit flavored ones were just using fruit juices from a box instead of muddled fruit which you see sometimes (and usually has a fresher taste). Tacos:Shrimp. They were made with baby shrimp. that's right, baby shrimp. like the kind you would see in crappy hole in the wall chinese take out fried rice. I don't even remember what they tasted like b/c I was so blown away by this use of cheap ingredients."rib eye" - so they say. these tacos had meat diced so finely and basically stirfried with onions and peppers it resembled a filling of a philly cheese steak without the cheese. needless to say not impressed.fish - these were ok but the battering on the fish was really thick and i just thought they felt too greasy and heavy. they were at least generous with the amount of fish in them, but maybe i was fooled by the sizes of the fish b/c they were so thickly encrusted with batter. Dessert sampler - average quality selection of mexican desserts. the churros had an elegant drizzle of hershey's syrup, like the one you get from the supermarket. Do you honestly think I'm going to think a thin, watery artificially chocolate tasting drizzle is anything else? come on.Service was very friendly but the food was really phoned in. This place is for the dos caminos crowd who think they've found something trendier and more local in the WV. For the same concept but MUCH better food i'd head to casa enrique in LIC.

Come here for HH! Made reservations for Saturday evening at 6pm, but once we arrived we sat in the bar area to get the happy hour deals (totally worth it) which ends at 7pm. We ordered ALOT of food: Salsas del Valiente: trio of salsas (chile de arbol was my favorite out of the 3) + warm chipsLa Loteria Crudité: fresh cut jicama & cucumbers w/a chili powder blend & lime + 2 different sauces De Fideo Vegetariano: tacos filled w/birds nest pasta, tomato-jalapeño cumin paste, avocado, cotija cheese, Mexican cream, w/sautéed mushrooms & spinach - my favorite itemPlatano Mucho: fried plantains, cream, & cotija cheeseYuca Frita: fried yuca w/habanero aioli dipping sauceGuacamole TradicionalTamarind, passion fruit, hibiscus, & guava margaritasThe food & service was great!! Will definitely come back again
Carlos was amazing and treated us so well! We were there for a birthday and he started us with tequila shots on the house. The food was all very good and nice portions

My co-workers and I are pretty enthused about this Mexican restaurant.  We've been doing lunchtime Restaurant Week for several seasons, and I have to say that this was the BEST EVER by far.  Last season we did Empellon Tacqueria, and I secretly thought this would suffer by comparison.  I was very pleasantly surprised.I had mushroom soup, flautitas and flan.  All were beautifully plated and delicious.  Service was efficient and friendly.We have returned since -- this restaurant will be on our regular lunchtime rotation.

Egregiously overpriced for Mexican food that is average, at best. I did enjoy the refried black beans. They were out of Esquites. Mexican restaurants ahold NEVER run out of Corn! Drinks were delicious but $18 for a Margarita with only 2, COUNT THEM, TWO pieces of fruit (Blackberry) is UNACCEPTABLE. Mexican rice-a-roni DOES NOT make Mexican rice remix. Tasted like garbage. I could only take 2 bites (2b must've been the theme of the evening.) Won't return.

The ambiance is amazing. If you're looking for chic, trendy, dim and intimate date spot, this is your place. I was in the mood for Mexican food but I wanted a place that was a little more elegant than a typical Mexican spot but not too expensive. The decor is very simple and European. The tacos were good and drinks were strong enough. I'd recommend their margaritas.

Incredible !!! Went for lunch. Absolutely Loved everything !!! Food was really fresh and delicious, not heavy . Service was good. I like the clean lines and modern space. The wine was really , really nice too. Excellant ! Will go back for sure !

This place is good, and I would describe it as more "Mexican influenced" than Mexican. The most Mexican things that we had were the margarita and Pacifico. We used to live in a border state and go to places in Mexico all the time. Enchiladas were tasty, fish tacos were nothing special, guacamole was good. The margarita was great.

Normally don't review online, but I had to give a shout out to this place.We went last night for dinner and ordered the chicharron tacos, ribeye tacos, and fish tacos, as well as margaritas and micheladas. The food was out of this world -- the chicharron was cooked to crispy perfection, the fish was lightly battered and delicious, and the toppings on each taco were fresh and tasty. The presentation of the food was also very nice.We weren't sure how big the portions would be so the 3 of us ordered two small (2 tacos each) and one large plate (4 tacos), and let me tell you it was FILLING. Everyone was stuffed at the end. Now, the main point of writing this review was to give a special thanks to the man (not sure if he was a waiter or another staff member) who came by to check how everything was. Earlier in the night we had actually moved tables because the corner we were in was too noisy to hear each other speak, and the seating was a little awkward. We moved to another spot, but later in the night a group of people at the bar started really getting loud, and it got hard to ignore them. The staff member saw us, brought us a dessert of churros on the house (also excellent!) and was just SO nice and apologetic. He didn't have to do that, but it was that extra service which made me write this place up :)

The service here is just out if this world. Waiter treated me like I was at home. Made great recommendations in terms of what to order, etc. I'm a recurrent custumer at this place because they treat me well and the food is authentic. I definitely recommed it.

What. a. great. happy. hour!The prices are great for the West Village and I was actually surprised by how empty the place was. We even made an unnecessary reservation for 6pm happy hour. The bar got a bit crowded as the evening went on - but the restaurant portion was nice a breathable.I love Mexican food and am especially fond of fish tacos, margaritas and guacamole. So a happy hour menu with $5 guac and $6 margaritas and $5 fish tacos.... excellent! I was worried about the size of the aforementioned $5 fish taco but the thing is huge and it's fried so it's super filling. Honestly, if you get some apps, you'd be totally fine with 1, maybe 2 tacos.All of the food we ordered was fresh and great quality... oh and the margaritas were nice and strong! I'll definitely be back to La Loteria, especially for Happy Hour!

Went to La Loteria this past Sunday night with a friend. While I waited for my friend to arrive, I sat at the bar and had a sangria - strong! And delicious. Everyone was super nice, service was wonderful, food was great. We ordered:- Tostaditas de Atun (Mexican style chili-rubbed pan seared tuna, sesame oil, guacamole, chipotle aoili, mango salsa, corn tostadas) - I could eat these forever. I wanted more. I dont even see them on the regular menu!- Ceviche - I didn't try any, but my friend said it was delicious- Pork belly tacos - *drool* - Fish tacos - I'm not a fan of battered fish tacos (I like grilled), but they were decent- Flan - yum!- Churros - a little too sweet for meI would come here again, for sure.

I went here on Jan 31 2016 on a Sunday afternoon and although the restaurant was virtually empty the bar area was full and I managed to get a little table by the door . The service is excellent and all wait staff were very helpful and explained in detailed when asked about a particular item on the menu. I had the Guacamole with the crackling chicken. It comes with a big bowl and 6 soft flour taco's and a large helping of chips if you prefer use instead or the tacos. I had a few drinks as well and overall the place was excellent.

Went here to try the Restaurant week menu out. It was packed! We got a drink at the bar while we waited for our table. The tamarind margarita which is one of their signature drinks, was amazing. Made the wait totally worth it! The place has a really nice vibe. As we sat down we ordered from the pre fixed menu (which had a lot of options!) and the food was served to us promptly. For starters we got the Mexican style corn- which was so flavourful and juicy, along with the baked cheese with chorizo. Everything was seasoned perfectly and tasted great. Loved the extra stringy cheese!! For the main course i got the enchiladas with pork which tasted great but I couldn't really enjoy them cause I was so full already :) for dessert we each got the three desserts on the fixed menu.. The caramel filled churros( that s right, CARAMEL FILLED churros!! I never knew such a thing existed... and so glad that it does), the flan and the tres leches. I am not exaggerating when I say that each of these were prepared flawlessly and tasted amazing. My night was made, start to finish!

There's no way a Mexican restaurant can receive a poor receive when its menu includes a lobster quesadilla. Instead of featuring a slew of traditional Mexican cusine (nachos, burritos, etc.), La Loteria has an eclectic twist on your favorites: fish tacos, squash and truffle empanadas and home fries, for example. The drinks are equally fun -- though I would recommend the blackberry margarita over the skinny iteration any day. La Loteria is small and has a trendy decor; however, the acoustics of the space are not great: the restaurant was relatively empty when I went and I found myself having a difficult time hearing my friend at the beginning of our meal. Regardless, will definitely come back again.
Food and drinks were super delish. We got the guac to start and split a pitcher of the classic margaritas. I got a sweet potato or squash vegetarian taco which was also amazing.
What a great place...atmosphere is spot on!  The food is fabulous and Carlos is a such a warm and welcoming host. Definitely make this a must see if you are in the area.

Ok. I was not crazy impressed here - but i think it was partially biased due to our seating location. We were in this cramped little table and wait staff had to push beside and behind us in all directions, which really upset the atmosphere. The drinks and guac were really good - the steak and scallop tacos were more on the 'alright' side of things. The staff was super nice and really great.

Just had amazing margaritas and chihuahua queso!! Rib eye, scallops, veggie enchilada, lobster quesadillas, wow! All great. Server (Jose) was really nice, helpful and fun. The evening got better and better as we went along. A real treat! We'll definitely be back.

A great spot for upscale Mexican. My friend made a dinner reservation for our large group, and they were able to seat us without needing the whole party to be there. I love that policy and it's much appreciated. The guac is above average but the waiter kept trying to take our mostly eaten bowl away. There was a "solid $4 worth of guac left" as my friend described, so that was a bit upsetting. Sadly we did not get any complimentary salsa for the table.I ordered the beet salad which was a good size portion and a nice lighter balance to the heavier chips. A couple of my friends ordered the fish tacos and raved about them. They were beatifully presented, almost like mini burritos. The menu is not clear but you can order either 2 or 4 tacos. I would suggest the restaurant offer 2 or 3, as these tacos were generously sized. Minus one star because for our large group, a 20% tip was automatically added. This was a bit steep given the guac controversy, so please consider reverting to the standard 18% tip.
Went here on a whim....pretty, pretty, pretty good! Amazing margaritas, guacamole & empanadas.

I came here for Sunday brunch in a group of 6 people. I was surprised to see how empty it was.I enjoyed the food and service, but it wasn't anything special. Service was attentive: They always kept my water glass full which is a pet peeve of mine.We started with the guacamole which was good. For my entree I had the fish tacos which were good, but I would have preferred if the fish was grilled instead of fried. My friends had the burritos, sunny side up egg dish, and the Mexican version of eggs benedict. The eggs benedict were overcooked, but my friends seemed to enjoy the other entrees. But they didn't rave about them. We also had mimosas and bloody marys, both of which were enjoyed. They were pricey for only 1, but would be a good deal if you wanted to do unlimited (ex: 1 mimosa is $10, 1 hour unlimited is $15). I don't think I would come back because they are so many amazing brunch spots in the West Village.

One of the best, if not the best, Mexican restaurants in NYC. I've had a lot of Mexican food in my life and this one tops them all. Came here for a birthday so I got to try a lot of things and I can confidently declare they are great. Definitely try the scallops, they were phenomenal.  Also the place itself is really nice and has a great ambiance.

A Mexican restaurant now this is flying colors as I am Mexican and I can say this was real Mexican cuisine freshly made tortillas their guacamole was really good their sauces combo was outstanding their fresh totopos as well. We had the queso fundido with chorizo amazing. We tried the ceviche this was he only disappointment too sweet we were expecting Mexican style ceviche so tons of lemon and a little spice. The tacos of carnitas and ribeye were really good! I tried their quinoa salad which was not that Mexican but really good with a touch of chipotle. The micheladas and clamato which are Mexican beer prepared drinks were ok a little diluted for our taste. We were a party of four great for groups. The service was really good. The music as Mexican as it gets really cool. The beer a lovely Mexican selection and it is located in a beautiful areas of NYC really close to NYU.
Love the food. Love the deco! Service is very friendly and attentive! Must try lobster quesadilla and their traditional quac

So soo sooo unimpressed with La Loteria.The food was ok. It wasn't a very memorable experience except for how cramped I felt in the dining area.When we showed up, there weren't many people there, but by the time we left, they were turning people away because they were so busy. The best food was the tacos.The guac combo was also good but the chips were so SALTY. I also remember it being closer to $$$ instead of $$ because we got the check and were confounded with how much it cost (for all of those wondering we did see the prices before we ordered too, it just felt SUPER expensive for what it was).

This was the most frustrated Ive been at a restaurant in a while. The stars go to the food decorations. The service deserves so many negative starts.We came in for brunch at 2pm. There werent that many tables, but there was only one server. She was not friendly at all. It took 15 minutes to get menus. When we ordered the bottomless drinks- it took 20 minutes to get out first round. We ordered an appetizer.....one hour later it was still not there. We were finally the last people in the restaurant- and we still had no food. I asked the waitress for an ETA, she gave me an annoyed look and then finally went into the kitchen. Finally our food was ready (this was over an hour after ordering).I think she had forgotten about our food. Mine was cold entirely. I wanted to ask them to pop it into the microwave or something, but decided that it would take another hour to get it back. This server was lucky that she put an auto-gratuity of 20% on our tab because none of us would have tipped her very well.Overall, I think the food could have been good but I couldnt really tell bc it was frigid by the time it got to me. The service needs some lessons in hospitality.

We came to La Loteria for dinner a Thursday and found it to be a well appointed restaurant with attentive service. We started with the Guacamole Combo which was very good. The salsa de cachuate enchilado (peanut) was a pleasant surprise. My dining companion enjoyed her guava flavored traditional margarita. The reason I am only rating my experience at 3 stars is because of the execution of my entree; I ordered the Enchiladas Callejeras and my companion the Tacos de Pescado Baja style. The entrees came out within 5 minutes of our order which seems a little fast and made me question how pre-made our entrees were. In my dish, the mole sauce was excellent but the panela cheese in the enchiladas was tepid and flavorless. I believe the plain enchiladas were made well ahead of time hence lacking an opportunity to absorb the flavors of the mole. I was underwhelmed by a dish that seemed to have a lot of promise. Regardless, I will return to try other dishes and hope for better execution.
My friends and I came here for a birthday celebration and the service was friendly and accommodating. Great place for a party of 6, or can be a cute date spot for a party of 2. Definitely recommend!
Great service..came for happy hour...Margaritas GREAT!! Food Great!..ordered steak tacos....bartender Yuri was great..will definitely come again.

Just go! Brunch. You will not be sorry. Food is wonderful. Guacamole app- YUM!  My husband had the Sincronizada La Loteria. He raved about the Mole sauce. I had the Huevos de Benito- I almost changed my mind at the last minute- thought it may have been too spicy. It was ridiculously good. We will be back. Great service nice decor.

Overpriced and poor quality food. Had the enchilada with beef. Tough meat and barely edible. Service is good and it is nicely decorated. But, bad soundproofing and it is so loud when full that you can barely talk. Definitely crossed off my list!

I came to this restaurant because I like the indications for gluten-free, vegetarian items on their menu. Also, the main ingredients of the dishes are clearly listed. It makes things easier for people with food allergies or sensitivities.I had 2 starters:Guacamole Combo: it's the Guacamole traditional served in a stone bowl and chips, with a trio of specialty salsas - de cacahuate enchilado (mild), salsa verde cruda (spicy), roasted chile de arbol (very spicy). The cacahuate enchilado is made with peanuts, chilies. It's the most pleasant to eat because it's mild. The verde cruda is made of raw tomatillos, cilantro, jalapeno, garlic. The chile de arbol is made with tomatoes, arbol chilies, cilantro, onions. The guacamole is a good complement to the spicy salsas. La Loteria Crudite: fresh cut jicama, cucumber and carrots topped with special chili powder blend, served with lime sauce and cream. The jicama is crunchy and juicy like an Asian pear.  The dipping sauce is sweet and tangy. I really appreciate the jicama and the cucumber, they are cooling and refreshing after having the spicy salsas. I would need these whenever I eat something spicy.The restaurant has large windows with a view on the 7th Avenue. It was quiet during lunch time and the service is good.

The food was amazing! I had pork tacos and they were delicious. I usually don't drink but had 2 passion fruit mojitos which were so good! The service and the bar were great. Overall, this spot seemed very trendy. There were a lot of young people including some models. I would definitely return for the food options and the lovely space.

Came for my girlfriends 27th birthday. Good ambiance, dim lighting, just loud enough to make it fun - but not annoyingly loud like in Meatpacking. The manager (larger dude) was SO amazing, took care of us from the beginning. Or table wasn't ready right away so he bought all 5 of us tequila shots. Also bought the birthday girl a margarita after we accidentally spilled a drink and then brought over dessert w a candle without us even asking. Amazing customer service! Food was good - but very spicey and super over priced in my opinion.

Best chilequiles I've ever had, and I think that says a lot given I'm from Cali. Service was very good. My dude forgot to specify that he wanted his tacos vegetarian, but they asked before it was made because I ordered mine as vegetarian. Great attention to detail. Not much of a crowd the times we went to dinner and lunch. I really hope this place lasts, cuz the food and service are great.
Service was a bit slow but the food and drinks were on point.  The tacos and the sauce that comes with them are a must order!
Wonderful new  Mexican restaurant with innovative tasty dishes, unique and flavorful presentations, and friendly attentive service. Fun atmosphere, great cocktails. Try the Loteria beef!

I wasn't sure what to expect when first trying this place, but I truly enjoyed it! The guacamole and trio of salsa's are good and I would say I enjoyed the peanut salsa the best. Something that I didn't expect to be good was the tuna from a Mexican restaurant, but this was my favorite appetizer. Since my first experience went well I decided to go back. I've had a majority of the items on the menu, my group of friends and I like to share, but I would have to say the fish tacos (portion bigger than expected) and the steak tacos were the favorite. The Blackberry and passion fruit margaritas have a good amount of alcohol in them with nice flavors. My only negative about this place would be the happy hour rules. Happy hour is only until 7, but you can only get the happy hour in the lounge area. The lounge area has at most 10 seats and is very tight. I wish happy hour was throughout the who place until 7. All and all definitely a place to try if your in the west village.
Get the Guava Margs!  Insanely delicious!  Also, the shrimp tacos were fantastic and chock full of shrimp!

Total win. Food, drinks & service all stellar. Guacamole was delishous and the 3 different salsas were great too! The lobster ceviche was better than I could ever have expected & a rare great sized portion for an appetizer. Also got the tuna appetizer and shrimp tacos. So pleasantly surprised by all things La Loteria.

I went here the other night with my boyfriend and loved it!Atmosphere: A great date restaurant. Dimly lit but you can still read the menu.Service: Service was excellent.Cost: We came during restaurant week and they had a great prix fix menu. The prices on the regular menu looked reasonable considering their location in the West Village. Food: The food was delicious. We had the chile-rubbed pan-seared tuna and the shredded duck-confit for appetizers, fish tacos and braised skirt steak for our entrees and the churros and tres leches cake for dessert. We had a number of drinks and they were all very inventive and tasty! One of them was a jalapeno margarita which was great. I will definitely be going back.

Good service. Dog friendly and outdoor seating which is a plus. We went for brunch and had their barbacoa tacos and chilaquiles. Chilaquiles were well portioned and delicious, highly recommend! The taco were average tasty. Corn tortilla and heavy in meat but the seasoning could have been more plentiful/better.

Really wasn't sure what to expect with La Loteria given the mixed reviews and how unpredictable restaurant week can be. And when I arrived for my 7:30 reservation there were quite a few tables open- never a good sign in the West Village!But damn, La Loteria is amazing. This is trendy yet traditional Mexican at its best. Everything from the little mango gazpacho tasting (on the house) to the tuna tostaditas to the flan blew my mind. But the real star was the steak - shredded and slow cooked in banana leaves with tequila and beer. What more could a gal want? Add a few margaritas and I was very, very happy. And everything was so fresh and *relatively* light! Our server was super nice as well. She had a lot of tables but never seemed overwhelmed. If the restaurant week menu is any indication of the quality of their regular dishes, La Loteria is my new favorite Mexican restaurant.

GREAT FOOD!!!!!I went to La Loteria for lunch and everything was amazing.Here's what I had (or tasted from my friend's plate):1) Guacamole: Some of the best I've ever had. I had it with the pork belly on top which I've never seen before and I highly recommend it. 2) Salsas del Valiente: 3 different salsas. All very good. I preferred the verde one the best, but they were all great. 3) Fish taco: Amazing. Seriously, I'm not a fish person and I never thought I would say that I liked a fish taco. It was perfection.4) Barbacoa de Arrachera Taco (skirt steak): Great and the sauce that camewith it was amazing.5) Empanada with squash blossom: WOW. Outstanding. loved it6) Empanada with chorizo: Really great, but the squash blossom still rated #1 for me. The chorizo empanada is really rich and intense and delicious though.7) Margaritas: I had a Hibiscus style which was very delicious and I had a Passion Fruit which is one of the best margaritas I've ever had. I don't know what they put in the passion fruit one, but it was DEEEE-LISCIOUS.8) Churros: We had churros for dessert that were willed with some kind of sinful delight accompanied by a chocolate dipping sauce. These were a perfect end to a perfect meal. YUM!The service was really great and I love the design of the place. There is also a bar at the front if you just want to grab a cocktail with friend's. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
The margaritas are my favorite in NYC. The tuna tostadas and the fish tacos were so good. The server was really attentive and the environment super friendly and classy.
Thumbs up. Great service (thanks Aaron). Excellent food. Not the same old Mexican restaurant!

Very good location. Waiter was very personable.  Good spot to sit outside and enjoy the foot traffic.  I just had an appetizer and Mojito so not much to say.  The Mojito was excellent.  The guacamole wasn't bad, but wasn't the best I've had

I can't complain much about  my experience here last night except the fact that upon ordering two bottles of wine our waiter brought them to the table already opened? I know I shouldn't order wine at a Mexican joint but still, oh and he over-poured every time.....I had a 8:30 rese for 6 on a Wednesday night and when we walked in on time the place was full except for the bar area which was empty. We were seated right away at a cute booth along the wall. Our service was OK but with a mandatory 20% already tacked on I'm not sure how above and beyond the guy went, see wine faux pas above. We ended up ordering WAY too much food to the point that we cancelled some of our entrees because we were getting so full. It turned out to be the way to go because the entrees are definitely the weak link. We started with the trio of salsas and both the regular guacamole and the guac with chicken added. The salsas were very tasty and the quac with chicken was an interesting change. We ordered the ceviche de pescado which was fabulous and I'm not a ceviche fan. We also had a few orders of empanadas, both the de papa con chorizo, ab fab, and the de flor de calabaza huitacoche also very good, well made with a bunch of great flavors. My friend ordered the fish tacos and although I'm not a huge fan of breaded fish tacos, these were the best I've ever had and coming from a Cali girl, that's sayin a lot! My babe and I shared the Barbacoa de arrachera and this was the only dish that was meh..a bit dry. Another friend had the enchiladas callejeras with skirt steak and the portion was so huge she barely put a dent in it. Add in a final lobster quesadilla that was another winner and everyone had full doggie bags to enjoy the next day. Great new Mexican spot.

Very accommodating to our group of 8.  Great service and tacos were delicious.  Fish tacos were my favorite.  The margaritas weren't that great, but that would be the only complaint. Other than that we had a good time.

I really like La Loteria. It's a very welcome addition to the neighborhood, and in a city with very inconsistent Mexican good, this place does it right. The food is consistently delicious and the service is very good. The reason I gave this phase a 2 star review is because I was very disappointed the other night when I went there on a date. It was a Friday night and not too busy when I got there, but filled up over the course of dinner. As usual, the food was delicious and the service was great. After we finished with all of the food we ate, we were sitting for no more than 5 or so minutes when a hostess (I believe she was a hostess), gave us one of those, "I'm so sorry but we have people waiting and need you to leave." There was at least one open table and no one was waiting at the door, just at the bar. My date and I got up and left, but we were there from start to finish for just over and hour, and I thought this was rude. If we had been lounging for 30 minutes or something and showed no signs of leaving, I get that, but this is really bad customer service. For a place charging an average of $15 for two smaller sized tacos, I'm very disappointed. I have raved about this place to friends, but now question if I will return. I'm sorry, La Loteria, but this is just not acceptable in my opinion!

I went for the Happy Hour. Many drinks and menu items in the $5-$6 range.  The preparation was fine dining all the way. Subtle unusual flavors, perfectly cooked. Whoever said that about a fish taco and yucca fries?!!  GO!!

3 1/2 stars. La loteria is good in a sea of some either pretty bad or overpriced Mexican food in the west village area. But it is not without it's problems. Pros: the happy hour. Great prices. $6 margs (+2 for flavors like guava and blackberry) $5 stone bowl guacamole. Guac was creamy, fresh, with a good kick of spice to it. The rest of the good options, fish tacos, tuna tostadas, sea bass ceviche, elote, all delicious. Restaurant has a cool relaxed vibe with windows open on nice days (I was told outside seating is on its way!) Presentation of all was beautiful and the fish tacos were really really good.Cons: why are individual tacos $5? That's steep. Anywhere. On happy hour that's ridiculous. The classic margarita was a strong pour of tequila which is great, but it looked more like a screwdriver or a mimosa than a margarita. Their mix was so heavy on the orange juice we were drinking pulp with tequila and that I didn't like. The ceviche while tasty had such few pieces of sea bass in it it felt incomplete. Definitely lacking. Service was attentive and friendly, yet a bit lost. They couldn't answer simple questions, didn't know what bourbons were behind their bar, and brought out silverware as we were getting our meal. Not a big deal, just a bit disjointed. Overall: delicious food with great presentation. $5 stone bowl guacamole is a steal!! Skip the classic marg and go for a flavor or the sangria.

I have lived in LA and NYC and this is the best fine Mexican food I have ever had! I am still dreaming about it. I've been here twice now- once for brunch and once for dinner. Hands down best brunch ever. Period. For dinner- The squash blossom empanadas were delicious as well as the main course scallop dish. I had a jalapeño margarita...ok maybe 2... That was perfectly spicy and flavorful. Not too sweet. I think the bartender said the tequila is infused with jalapeño in house! Our bartenders were friendly and attentive and I love the atmosphere. Kind of modern rustic with some great black and white gorgeous floor tile. i just can't believe this place is in my neighborhood and doesn't have a line out the door.

Went last night at daughter's suggestion and was not disappointed.  Typically do not take time to write these but had to make the effort here.  Dustin is an all around great bartender and service at table was top notch too ... Jovana equally 5-stars.  Split a few apps and entrees and each was excellent.  Great place and great people!!!

La Loteria is as authentic as you get in a modern presentation of Mexican food. The food is so fresh and delicious and everyone here is super friendly and menu helpful. The drinks are also quite elaborate and enjoyable. Dinner and Brunch have been a home run each time I have been here. Ask for their homemade hot sauce as it is a great fire in your mouth : )))

Best Mexican food in the neighborhood by far.  Their breakfast burrito is the best thing I have eaten in a long time.  They also have a very good brunch margarita deal (1 hour unlimited for $25). We even took a Californian to Loteria (and we all know how they can be about Mexican food) and he thought it was amazing!!!!

This place is THE BEST Mexican restaurant in Manhattan. I've been to Mexico, Texas, California, Arizona, you name it. This place is legit! Had brunch and dinner there several times and all the food is delicious. Servers are super friendly and very attentive. Get the chilaquiles, breakfast burritos, empanadas de con chorizo, and rib eye tacos. Or just get everything. Good dranks (margaritas) too!
Good drink selection. Really good yucca fries and really good guacamole.Scallops are good. Shrimp tacos are good, too.
Do not go. Place stinks. Took 2 HOURS to get lunch "to go." Tacos are as small as a pebble and have 0 flavor. Major issues in the kitchen. Get cozy because this service is amateur night. Must miss!
Amazing happy hour. The location isn't the best (or worst) but the food is heaps better than El Toro Blancos (although they have better guacamole).

Awesome tacos, excellent margaritas (especially the tamarind version) and lively atmosphere make this a great addition to the Mexican options for dining out.The fish/slaw tacos are AMAZING! Flavorful beyond belief.  Big fan! Can't wait to return. Loved the guacamole, too....
We were looking for a place to have lunch/brunch and wandered in here. Excellent choice. The food and service was great. I can't wait to come back for dinner.

Very delicious food. I'm not a brunch person (don't love breakfast foods/eggs) and came for brunch. Lots of good non-breakfast items on the brunch menu to choose from, and my meal was delicious. My fiancé's equiv of eggs benedict was also delicious (I tried a bite...and I never like eggs). Can't wait to try for dinner. Great space and friendly staff also. Definitely recommend.

Really great food - outstanding actually. Awesome cocktails. I love how they identify items that are gluten free! My only negative feedback was that the tables were so close together that I couldn't stand up without my ass being shoved in someone's face.

Love this placeI came here for the 1st time by myself for Happy Hour.I sat at the bar and the margaritas and chips and salsa(s) were absolutely delicious!I then ordered 2 pork tacos from the happy hour menu, and they were fabulous.Great service and really cute, trendy vibe!  They had dance music bumpin', and it made me feel like I was in Miami!I live in Kips Bay, but I will definitely venture back to this place.;-)
Pretty good tacos - bonus points for making an extra special batch of guacamole without cilantro for me!

Solid Mexican in the lower West Village.  Great atmosphere, tasty cocktails -- I preferred the mango margarita to the blueberry mexcal.  The guac was good, but the salsa sides were the real winner. That and the chicken enchiladas, large portions and very good.

I went to La Loteria for the first time last night - it is not in the best/busiest location of the West Village, and could be easily missed. I'm glad that I stopped in, and will definitely tell my friends about it so that they can try it too!We started off with cocktails: the El Soldado Magarita (a jalapeno margarita) and the El Cottoro (a Gin/Rosemary/Lime/Basil drink). Both drinks were very good, but had way too much ice and seemed a little watered down. Next time, I will ask for less ice to see if that solves the problem.We split one small plate as an appetizer: the Tostaditas de Atun. I loved this dish, and highly recommend it. It is tuna, sesame oil, chipotle aioli and mango salsa on corn tostadas, served over little dollops of guacamole. There were only 5 tostadas on the plate though, so keep that in mind when ordering.We did not get any guacamole, but the table next to us ordered the Guacamole de Puerco Enchilado (served with pork belly and chile ancho dust), and it looked incredible. It was also a very big serving.I got the Pork Belly Enchiladas as an entree. I thought that it was great -- at first, I thought the way that it was served was pretty odd - the cheese enchiladas were served over potatoes and peas, with the pork belly on top of the enchiladas (as opposed to inside). However, once everything was cut up, it went together very well. I would recommend this dish, and the only complaint is that I think the potatoes were too filling for the dish - I would have preferred to have them on the side.We ordered a side of the Yuca Fries, but they were nothing special - I probably would get the plantains next time.I definitely plan to come back to La Loteria in the future.

Delicious food!! Great drinks!! HORRENDOUS SERVICE! I went for my birthday dinner with 5 others (total 6). We had a reservation and the restaurant was busy but not packed. Perhaps they were understaffed that day however, when you know you have a reservation and it is a Friday night there should have been a better solution in place.At one point the bartender may have been our waiter then another lady then another man. Some of our food didn't come out (but it was also taken off the bill). More annoying was that they did not have many drinks because ingredients were gone! Between the service and the amount of drinks they could not make, I was disappointed. BUT I am absolutely willing to try this place again because the food is delicious!

a little expensive, the service was rushed (stop asking me if im ready to order! i wasn't the last 3 times you asked!) and the noise level was beyond loud.  I'll chalk all this up to growing pains, because this food was amazing!!!!!!  Mexican is my fave and this did not disappoint - might be the best i have had in the city. the food made up for the annoying service, and the hibiscus margarita was divine. the fish tacos were huge, delish and i'm already planning a return trip. For real tho, the service was surly and annoying from bar/waitstaff/hostess/bus people. this is a tiny venue with tiny tables and no room to move around or wait for a table. the hostess asked our party of 6 to vacate because there were so many tables waiting...  I have to take a star off for that, but the food is 5 stars for sure.

Upon entering this beautifully designed West Village gem, you instantly feel the vibe and know you're in for a good night. After ordering our carefully crafted cocktails, we glanced over the menu and wanted to order everything in sight! Partly because we didnt want to over do it, we opted for the finger-licking-good Guac (with pork belly chunks), the over-sized Empanadas, the Barbacoa Tacos, and the lobster filled Quesadillas...not to mention the grilled corn and cinnamon and sugar dusted plantains for sides. What can I say, it was a feast to say the least.For dessert, we ordered the Churros, the Flan and the Guava mini cheesecakes - we were not disappointed by anything!! The service, decor, and ambiance (a bit dead - maybe because it was late), was on par.Overall, one of the best Mexican dining experiences I've had so far in my (foodie) life! We definitely won "La Loteria" (the lottery) here! Even with so many options in this City, I'll definitely be back for more!

Delightful night out at La Loteria. Food was excellent and service superb. Every morsel was delicious. Highly recommend the fish taco, lobster quesadilla, and the side of plantains even though we really enjoyed all five dishes that we shared. Chicken and guacamole - great combo. We will definitely be back. Well done Julieta!

To start with the critique I gotta say it bothered me that the pork belly pieces in the tacos were literally all fat, to the point we thought they were diced potatoes. I get that that makes for great flavor and texture but I'd like to eat more than just cubes of lard. A little more protein in there please. The corn side was an absolute star, I'd dare anyone to find better. Perfectly seasoned and charred.The flautas were delicious though the masa could have been a bit thinner like the authentic kind. The different salsas were amazing. The jalapeño infused margarita was excellent though not hot enough. I got very little kick from mine which is really the point of this margarita. The food is really good but the approach to the ingredients is a little too bougy.Excellent service even in a Saturday night.
Amazing cuisine in an incredibly festive atmosphere. I'm coming back!!!!The drinks were delicious, the guacamole inventive and the food was tasty!!

Really wonderful meal here. For starters, the staff was really attentive and kind. The food was really delicious. Highly recommend the ceviche de pescado. Fish was fresh and a really nice balance between the citrus-lime and tomatillo. Then the fish taco and pork tacos were both fantastics. Classic fish taco - crispy fish with a slaw and mayo-based sauce. The pork tacos were pork belly at its finest.

Loved this place. It had a really good atmosphere plus the food we had was amazing! We had their margaritas while we waited for our table. They were really good and they have a bunch of different flavors. The nachos and dips were fabulous and the portion was huge! There was only two of us eating it as a starter but it could easily be shared by 4 people.  The main highlight for us was the fish tacos. These were the best fish tacos I've ever had. I cannot wait to go back and get them again. I would give this place a five if it weren't for the fact that there was a slight mess up with our order that left us short a few tacos but I think it was just extra busy and also there were changes to the menu that weekend so that probably was the reason for the slip up. Nevertheless, I will definitely be going back for those fish tacos!

Just enjoyed a casual dinner at La Loteria and would definitely go back.Friendly vibe with attentive service. We enjoyed the cocktails and margaritas as well as the guac and pork belly tacos thanks to the other yelp reviews.Cute new spot in the West Village.

I met a friend at La Loteria. I was so excited to try this place, but was unfortunately disappointed. The food was absolutely wonderful, but the service left much to be desired. After ordering a drink and requesting no salt twice. I received it with salt. The waiter took forever to get back to us to take our order. After we had been waiting on our food for 30 minutes, he came back by and asked us if we were ready to order. I politely informed him we had been waiting for 30 minutes and he didn't seam to care that much.

La Loteria is definitely out of this world. Its not authentic Mexican food but close enough for you to say "Ahi Chiwawa" haha!. Food is not overly spicy and  the flavors stand out in every bite you take. The service is excellent and even though the bartender was the one serving us, he made it his business to make my group as comfortable as possible. The Churros were excellent! They were decadent, crispy and soft in the inside with a nice warm caramel cream filling that gooed in every bite you took. The dipping was a choice of chocolate ad caramel together, both frosted with powdered sugar. Everything warm and just melted in your mouth. A glass of Sangria or even a cup of coffee would complement this delicious dessert. I highly recommend this vibrant and cozy place for either lunch or dinner.
Way overpriced and the portions are very small. There are so many other great Mexican restaurants in the West Village.
It is a place with great mexican food! DO NOT ORDER THE TACOS! You will get TWO TINY tacos for an entry price. I recommend the chilaquiles or huevos benito (they are amazing).
Food is great. But prepare yourself for two tacos!! If there were three I wouldn't complain. I would suggest ordering the chilaquiles or huevos Benito.

I don't normally spend time doing reviews, but feel this restaurant has potential and felt compelled to share my thoughts as they are new to my neighborhood and I would like to see them succeed. The food is quite good, which is why they get 4 stars. We had the chips and guacamole, pork belly and fish tacos, scallops and the lobster quesadilla. The food was all well prepared and the portions were generous. The issue here is the service. We ordered a pitcher of margaritas right when we sat down. The margaritas were average tasting, being a bit too sweet for my taste. However, we finished the pitcher while having the appetizers and were never offered any additional drinks. The servers never checked on us to see how we were doing, so we never had a chance to order anything more to drink. At $60/pitcher, this is a huge miss for the restaurant, since drinks are where they make all their margin. The servers did not smile, did not say thank you when we left and overall need to be upgraded and/or trained if this place is going to succeed.
Definily recommend great place , awesome food authentic Mexican food Drinks are delicious all they made w fresh fruit.

Almost 4 stars. Food was so good. The guacamole portion was small but delicious. The decor is great and the place is hitting all the right notes. However in this freezing cold weather there is no coat check and they don't seem prepared for big crowds. They were stealing chairs from other tables and squeezing people in. I am sure they will figure that out. It's a must go place. The food is very good and the staff are very nice and courteous. The drinks were top notch. This a great addition to the west village. I look forward to them doing very well. Totally worth the try.

Love it Love it love my Handsome bartender Ukrainian guy, Yuriy. Love to drinking my cocktails and have great company with him ! Great service. Enjoyable place and my tacos was awesome!My new best Mexican restaurant in NYC!

The other night I went to La Loteria for the sixth time since it opened.  With so many options in the Village alone, I could easily go somewhere else, but the food so good, we wanted to go back and try almost everything.While I have been here before, I am glad that I held off on doing a review until now because while the food has always been top-notch, they recently finished putting the finishing touches on the restaurant and the setting is now just as good as the food.  Since my last visit textured wood was added to two walls and mirrors with an antique finish were put up near the bar.  Between the Mexican artwork and overall design, the finished result is a beautiful spot to enjoy some excellent food.On our most recent visits, we enjoyed the guacamole, which is served in a traditional molcajete, which seems to be made from volcanic rock.  So many places serve this Mexican favorite, but many miss the mark.  Thankfully, Loteria's version is perfect and just the right start to a meal.Speaking of starting a meal, the cocktails are another treat here.  Often, I steer clear of the cocktail list because the drinks sound so good and then usually disappoint.  The Alacran, made with Tamarind infused vodka and triple sec, was definitely not a disappointment. La Dama was another great cocktail. On to the main event.... far and away my favorite entree is the scallop dish, which is truly amazing.  It is called Callo de hacha al huitlacoche negro, which is diver sea scallops served atop huitlacoche, which I learned is a Mexican delicacy, a truffle that grows on the corn. It's velvety smooth and I think the ingredient that makes this dish so delicious.  Under the scallops and the huitlacoche is a sweet potato goat cheese corn bread, which pulls everything together.  So, definitely make sure you try this when you go to Loteria.Another hit in my book is the lobster quesadilla. In addition to lobster, this dish also includes black beans and chihuahua cheese and a guava-morita chile paste.  The paste adds a bit of sweetness that's a different touch, but it is definitely another great dish.After all that, Loteria's desserts are also exceptional.  I got a friend who usually skips dessert to join me for the crepas and I heard no complaints. That dulce de leche was so good with a touch of salt!  And there's flan, which is another perfect ending.  I liked that it was not the gelatinous type of dessert that flan can be, but actually had a firmer texture somewhere between flan from Spain and cheesecake.  Two thumbs way up for Loteria's version!As I've already said, Loteria does not disappoint in the food department.  I am happy to report that the same holds true on the service front.  The staff is very helpful and efficient.  I also enjoyed a couple of meals at the bar where the bartenders were very helpful with drink and dinner suggestions.  Even when there might be a slight slip-up, Loteria is quick to remedy the situation.  Shortly after their opening, there was a very small mixup and the chef came out to apologize and gave us her card and said to let her know if we came back.  I thought this was very classy.  Another time it was a busy night and the food took just a little longer and the bartender came over to say he would go back and check.  Such service is a mark of excellence at a restaurant and Loteria gets it right.While the West Village has added a number of restaurants recently, I would definitely recommend a visit to Loteria.  And then maybe a couple more... Enjoy!

Just had a wonderful Valentines dinner at La Loteria! My bf and I had a reso at La Esquina but given their horrible management were stuck high and dry at 5pm today....We were able to snag a reservation at La Loteria last minute, which saved the day! Price fixed menu that actually turned out fairly decently. The lobster ceviche was delicious and my bfs smoked oyster tacos were also very well done.Entrées (scallops ane duck) were also tasty and the servers had timing down really well (probably a good thing a new restaurant did a price fixed menu).Churros were the highlight and my only suggestion would be to add more flavor to the rice and bean side dishes.Ambiance not too romantic but not too plain either -- it wouldn't be my choice for a super intimate meal but it gets the job done! Good option for a regular ol date night. Not good for groups -- space is awkard ly shapes like a triangle inside

We made reservations for  this restaurant three weeks ago primarily because it had large vegetarian options and wasnt price fixed.     We have a friend in from town and we didnt want a romantic night.  The restaurant called us TODAY on Valentines that the restaurant changed their menu a week ago to price fixed, and of course vegetarian  was an afterthought not on that price fixed menu.  It was a lesser expensive taco. Plus it came with champagne not the margaritas we wanted.        Now we are stuck without any plans because they told us so last minute.  This is unacceptable for a new restaurant to treat potential customers this way.

I came by during their opening week and had a great meal. The rib eye tacos were delicious, and our order of churros for desert were great! Looking forward to trying them out for brunch, which I've heard is one of the more authentic Monterrey, MX style brunches in the city.

This may be the best Mexican food in NYC. The only competition is Toloache. Loteria is way better than Dos Cam, or Rosa Mex, it's fresher and the flavors more intense and interesting. The enchiladas come with a dusky mole sauce, dark, spicy sweet and who knew you could put pomegranate seeds on there?! Great margarita, too. Love this place!   But I think the decor is a bit too West Elm.

New York has a dearth of good Mexican food, and this place stands out as the best of the upscale places. It's a really attractive spot on a great corner, and the food was truly excellent from start to finish. Highlights were the braised skirt steak, flautas, empanadas, and guacamole.

Great place, had dinner here last night. Everyone was really kind and attentive. Ordered the guacamole to start and it was delicious! Really spicy but delicious. It was packed, ended up sitting at a small table in front of the bar area because we didn't want to wait. Only negative: waited over an hour for our food! But it was pretty good once it came out. Would come again!

I wanted to like this place. The decor is well done and it's in my neighborhood.  1 star for the prosPros - good guac and house made chips- decent ambience but awkward space. Didn't enjoy getting elbowed in the back every two second. Cons- weak drinks. Definitely do not order the sangria.- wait time to get the guac was about half an hour for each order..not that hard to make fresh guac.- taco orders are VERY small. Appetizer size really. Two tiny tacos for an entree price. The thin, soggy tortilla reminds me of a store bought one. I much prefer homemade tortillas.- don't get the beet salad. It was overcooked and dull. It's also again a very small salad.- enchiladas missed the mark. Covering it in mole sauce didn't help either.- quesadillas were average.- HORRENDOUS customer service. There's a way to communicate the wait time to your customers. If you say it's half an hour, it should never be TWO hours. I HATE when restaurants lie about the wait time to get you to spend more at the bar. - the wait time continued to be unacceptably long once we sat down. We came in at 7:30p. Didn't eat until close to 11/11:30.- the manager needs to learn how to be gracious when she's wrong. She had a terrible attitude and was incredibly rude about the whole situation, which definitely didn't help the experience.Won't be coming back.

Love this restaurant and could be our go-to for Mexican fare.The food is a standout and has probably one of the best micheladas in NYC!I would say this restaurant also has the tastiest pork tacos - usually it's quite dry and tasteless but this was very tasty! Would also recommend the guacamole, battered fish tacos as well as the churros!Can't wait to try other dishes when we come back.

Great new spot in the West Village! I like the modern twist on Mexican fare that La Loteria offers. The atmosphere is very inviting and the space itself is very cute.
