All staff and servers were extremely friendly and attentive. I came with a party of four on a Friday at 7pm for dinner. I had made a reservation just in case it was crowded. When we arrived a 7, it wasn't too packed but closer to about 8:30pm it was full. I definitely recommend making a reservation. The food is excellent. I tried the De Fiedeo Vegetarian tacos, which were two tacos with thin pasta and tomato-jalapeno cumin sauce, sautéed mushrooms, spinach, avocado, cotija cheese, and crema. It was certainly one of the more unique selections on the menu, as I've never had thin pasta on a taco before. It was delicious! My friends tried the pork belly tacos, fish tacos, and the Flautitas de Pato. They loved their dishes and raved about the pork belly tacos. We also received an espresso sized cup of black bean soup to try on the house.  The drinks were also delicious! Between the 4 of us we tried the traditional margarita, jalapeño margarita, and the Michelada. They were all super tasty.  I will definitely return to La Loteria!

Two thumbs up!! To quote the random guy sitting next to me at the bar " This place is definitely going to be my new local!"The drinks are great. My favorite was the jalapeño margarita. Just enough of a kick. The bartender Dustin definitely makes the best ones in my opinion. Plus, he was very attentive and super friendly. The food was also great. I couldn't get enough of their queso fundido. What's better than a gooey bowl of melty delicious cheese? And they use the real stuff, not that terrible yellow/orange "cheese" so many places use. They also provide fresh homemade corn tortillas. Their pork belly tacos are also great. I can't wait to go back and check out the rest of their menu. Definitely worth checking out.

Mexican food at its finest with exceptional customer service. Extremely impressed for a new establishment. Ok, I'll admit to the the potential for a bias review here, hell, I know the owners and one is actually my neighbor and a friend. But he also knows I along with my posse are all picky eaters and never one to hold back. So, I've been following his journey to finally getting his first eatery off the ground for close to two years now, so figured I'd give him at least a month after opening before paying a visit. And boy oh boy, why did I wait so long! Just an incredible experience from the time we arrived until we left.Being a Thursday night with a full restaurant was a first good sign for new restaurant. It's a great location in the west village and the interior and design layout present a modern chic laid back Mexican feel.  Airy with big windows that when open will make for an even greater vibe in spring and summer. But enough with the aesthetics, for when venturing out to a restaurant, what really matters is the food! And happy to say, La Loteria delivers here hands down!We were offered a few margaritas to get the party started and they were on point! If you're into Margaritas you wont be disappointed. Menu consists of starters, small plates, tacos, entrees and sides. We started with the Guacamole tradicional, which came with warm chips, this has to be some of the best guacamole i've ever tasted in a restaurant. Soon to follow were Empanadas/De flor de Calabaza y Huitlacoche, light perfectly cooked and delicioso! Next up was the Ceviche de Pescado but we had it with Shrimp instead, another winner. As a follow up, soon to arrive was the De Pescado Baja style, its an incredible delicious taco with Mexican beer battered fish and just oooh sooooo good! And the final act, out came the Quesadilla de langost estilo Rosarito, this is sauteed lobster with other ingredients packed into a a flour tortilla which was one of my favorites. After dinner drinks were a few shots of some of the finest tequila this side of the border. And all the above reasonably priced with exceptional service. Everyone in my party thoroughly enjoyed themselves and were totally impressed. Can't wait for a return visit to try out more of the menu! Truly is a great find and next time you're looking for some great Mexican food in a very cool spot in the West Village, La Loteria should be your only choice. I'd be sure to make reservations because once the word gets out, I foresee difficulty in easily getting a table here. Hopefully me knowing the owner will help! Hey, don't hate, we all use those connections when we have too! :)

Great customer service. Came here for lunch. Was pleasantly surprised at how tasty the food was. Excellent customer service. Our margaritas were a little tart but we enjoyed the food so much we didn't mention it. Then the waitress brought us two on the house. Maybe she read our minds? Either way great experience. Between the two of us we had sent plantain, creamed spinach and poblano soup, queso  with chorizo and queso with mushrooms. We also had guacamole. Corn and Mexican rice on the sides. The rice was the only thing that could have been better

Wow, I was pretty impressed, my first visit, and I'm a local west village foodie.  The guacamole is a must, I recommend the chicken guac.  The tacos were delicious; I had the shrimp, and the sangria was great.  Look, there are a ton of Mexican good places in the neighborhood, however this is one of the only ones that not only felt authentic, but caters to the picky foodie's of nyc.  It's only a matter of time before the world finds out about this place; but its affordable, creative, and good vibe will surely be a hit!  I only hope it doesn't get impossible to get a seat post the grand opening.- foodie Paul
